story:
You Can Help Us Make Entrepreneurs and Inventors

Makersville is a grassroots, inclusive community of creative and technical makers in Long Beach, CA.  Since 2012 we have been working to create programs for youth that involve hands-on learning.  We have a group of committed Makers who have built programs in game design, latex mask making, toy making, programming, sewing, robotics, electronics and more,  using a play based approach that includes creativity triggers and aids like Minecraft, LEGO(r),  the Arduino.

It is through the Maker movement that we understand the need for and benefits of entrepreneurship and invention to provide a focus for learning.

Our makers have a wide variety of skills and life experiences.  Our program format has provided and continues to provide work, entrepreneurship, internship and mentoring opportunities to youth as young as 6 years old, home schooled youth from Great Educational Experiences, high school students and graduates from six Long Beach high schools.  Our makers have and are mentoring high school students in their senior projects.

We realize the need for students today to understand how they can make their own work happen, because we, the adult makers, work to make our own work happen.  We started our entrepreneurship program two years ago, with the hope that our students would make things for sale at a Christmas boutique.  With traditional methods of making things, our students were only able to make single prototypes, ones they wanted to keep!  We still love and want to use the traditional methods for technique and skills learning, but we need a way to create a small-run production capability, so as to give them their next learning opportunities; invention, entrepreneurship, budgeting, marketing and sale of their inventions and designs.

We need $25,000 to purchase an Epilog Zing 60 Watt Laser Cutter and Materials and to provide space and staffing for regular hours during the school year.

$25,000 will let us purchase the zing outright.  If we don't get that, we'll take a lease if we are able to get enough to cover the first year's lease payment and program, which we expect to be $15,000.  We are aiming at delivery 8 weeks after our goal is met.

During the school year, we expect the Zing to be housed at the Long Beach Sea Base.  We may take it out to locations where we are spending some time.  During the summer, we will move it to our summer camp location.

The Zing will be available to be used in our classes.  We'll etch patterns into denim and leather, cut paper pieces for cards, make delightful paper models, cardboard and wood models, cut wood and a variety of materials for robot bases, game pieces, puzzles, woodblock prints and project supports.  We'll make wooden gears.  We want to make Da Vinci models and wooden toys, boxes for electronics projects.  Our students will be able to visualize and create something, then do short runs of the items for their entrepreneurial experiences.

The Impact

We believe in helping others through the creation of sustainable systems anchored in skills learning and making.  We use invention and entrepreneurship as target goals.  We are extremely grateful for having been provided the opportunity to serve youth at two Title 1 Elementary Schools, and we are partnering with onsite scout and the after school program.  We hope to identify ways to help homeless families, a collaboration we're working on with the Scoutreach program of the Long Beach Area Council of the Boy Scouts of America.

Since 2012, we have worked to make a difference in the community in which we live.  We have helped to bring in substantial youth serving communities to the Sea Base and are ourselves one of those communities.  We've made a difference, but now we need your help in making a bigger difference.

We know that a piece of equipment such as this will attract new and different youth, mentors, makers, inventors and artists to our program.

Risks & Challenges

Our challenge is to create a viable maker space.

This campaign is our way of addressing that challenge.

The campaign perks, themselves, will ensure our community, as they will provide access to the makerspace and the equipment.

50% of all perks and 100% of donations is earmarked for makerspace equipment. 

If we do not reach our minimum goal of $15K within 60 days, purchasers of individual or group makerspace passes will have the option of receiving a refund, using the maker space without the laser cutter, or applying the purchase amount towards a Makersville class.  Purchasers of specific items will still receive their items.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help.  A donation of any amount helps but, if you can't contribute yourself, please help us to get the word out by sharing our campaign with as many friends as you can, but especially those who might benefit from one of the perks in our campaign.

Please also remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much! See you at the Sea Base!

story:
Hi,

My name is Artem. I am a PhD researcher and I need your help to fund my second research project. I have already completed one project, please check the link to see the research method and approach I used. I aim to apply the same high quality standard to the second study. If you contribute, your name (or nickname) will be acknowledged on the first page of the paper. Subject to a peer review, the study might be published in a reputable journal.

My first research project explored how subjects sustain cooperation when other users can report the outcomes of their prior interactions to the subject’s future partners, incurring a cost for doing so. We found that allowing such information transmission is an important factor in sustaining cooperation, although the cooperation level amongst users was modest.

Link to the first project - https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3608749

 

About the new experiment

This project will build on the initial work, incorporating natural language and verbal communications prevalent in online interactions. In contrast to the earlier project, this work enables users to provide a rating or comment at their expense, instead of incurring a cost for reporting their partner’s behaviour.

In order to provide a realistic environment, e.g. make participants treat risk, trust, and bargaining as they would do in a real interaction, all decisions are financially incentivised. It is common practice in experimental economics to undertake such experiments on University campus, with students being the participants. The expected average payment is usually above the minimum wage. Many previous studies confirmed that such a setting reflects real market conditions quite well, while keeping the costs reasonable.

Participants interact exclusively through a computerised environment, maintaining anonymity throughout the study. Consequently, only the experiment designers are aware of the subject’s true identities. Instructions shall be delivered to the subjects both verbally and on-screen, with each subject required to undertake a comprehension quiz prior to the experiment, which is designed to test their level of understanding. Any participants who don’t reach the pre-requisite threshold of understanding are excluded from the  subsequent decision-making tasks, reducing the likelihood of outliers. 

What the funding is for

The funds will go exclusively for subject payment. It is something I cannot afford on my own and is the main cost associated with the study. I am happy to cover other small costs myself, such as travel costs. Also, I do not keep any funds to cover my work time, because I love my job :)

What you get

I see many business projects on Indiegogo offer interesting perks and souvenirs, however I’m afraid I’m only able to offer something more humble. All contributors’ names (or aliases) will be acknowledged on the first page of the paper in the similar manner that we did in our first project.

Subject to a review, the study might be published in a peer-reviewed journal. My aim is to publish it in a reputable journal, however regardless of such publication, the study will be available through Google Scholar (https://scholar.google.com/) and SSRN (https://www.ssrn.com/index.cfm/en/) for other researchers to use. That means your contribution will not be in vain in any case.

The Impact

Any study can uncover different, sometimes unexpected, result. For example, a cost associated with leaving written feedback may hinder cooperation in a repeated interaction, or it may not. We do not know it yet, neither do other economists, but you can help us learn more about that.

Other ways you can help

If you can’t contribute please consider clicking that share button, to make your friends aware of my plea!

Thank you for reading this, have my virtual fist bump ;)

story:
Hello!

Our names are Paige and Nick. We are seniors at Basha High School. For our senior project, we are trying to raise money for young students whose families cannot afford the basic supplies needed for school. More than 200 million children younger than 5 years old fail to reach their fullest potential in cognitive development due to poverty.  We are fortunate to be in families that can afford the necessary school supplies that allows to best education as possible. We feel that all kids should be given the same opportunity as everyone else in education. For this project, we hope to help as any many young students as we can. All the donations raised will go to Pappas Schoolhouse Foundation.

We feel that all kids should be given the same opportunity as everyone else in education. For this project, we hope to help as any many young students as we can. All the donations raised will go to Pappas Schoolhouse Foundation.

story:
O que buscamos:  Nosso objetivo é dar um salto qualitativo para consolidar nuestra rede dando-lhe, assim, maior visibilidade aos problemas e debates sociopolíticos da região, através de projetos de investigação, publicações acadêmicas e de opinião e incidência política.  

Resultados esperados:

  • Novo website, mais funcional, completo e interativo, com os dois idiomas disponíves no mesmo espaço.
  • Email institucionais para facilitar a comunicação entre os membros da rede e com os demais colaboradores.
  • Publicação: “Istmo – sentidos, usos conceptuales y las distintas perspectivas sobre la región de Centroamérica/América Central/Mesomérica.” – um caderno de textos multidisciplinares sobre encontros históricos, límites políticos, identidades, relações culturais e de poder sobre a região.

                           ------------------===---------------------===--------------------

Lo que buscamos: Nuestro objetivo es impulsar un salto cualitativo para consolidar nuestra red dándole, así, mayor visibilidad a los problemas y debates sociopolíticos de la región, a través de proyectos de investigación, publicaciones academicas y de opinión e incidencia política. 

Resultados esperados:

  •  Nueva página web, más funcional, completa e interactiva, con los dos idiomas disponibles en el mismo espacio.
  • Correos institucionales para facilitar la comunicación entre los miembros da la red e con los demás colaboradores.
  • Publicación: “Istmo – sentidos, usos conceptuales y las distintas perspectivas sobre la región de Centroamérica/América Central/Mesomérica.” – un cuaderno de textos multidisciplinares sobre encuentros históricos, límites políticos, identidades, relaciones culturales y de poder, sobre la región.

story:
THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads crowd-funded transcontinental train journeys for diverse groups of young innovators (and virtual audiences) to explore America's new frontiers.

To get on board, applicants design a project to advance across the communities where our train stops and then race to be among the first 20 applicants to reach their $5k crowdfunding goal. The applicant's project is described below. 

Incentives For Inquiry

Incentives for Inquiry is an affordable educational solution that provides a safe space for inquiry, facilitates inquisitive thinking and cultivates an intellectual inquiry community. It will be an out-of-school experience with city and community based programming that will empower students to ask questions with confidence. The program will use design thinking and critical thinking exercises to prepare students for college and careers.

Students need critical thinking and questioning skills to close the skills gap

Students in K-12 are moving further and further away from asking questions. Some believe questioning makes them the target of jokes and bullying, while others are told asking questions is a disturbance in the classroom. Incentives for Inquiry is an affordable educational solution that provides a safe space for inquiry, facilitates inquisitive thinking and cultivates an intellectual inquiry community. Students and adults alike must be dedicated to life-long learning to be active decision-makers, leaders, creators and trailblazers. Incentives for Inquiry will be an out-of-school experience with city and community based programming that will empower students to ask questions with confidence.

Incentives for Inquiry will provide a safe space for questions students are afraid or unable to ask in the classroom, at home or in their everyday environments. Hands on activities will help each student leave the program with the confidence to ask questions anytime they need guidance and/or assistance and increase their critical thinking skills and knowledge.

I'm working on a pilot for Winter 2016

I will use the journey for customer discovery and iterating the idea to a tailored and executable pilot. I will be asking stakeholders (teachers, students, parents and community members) about the best method of implementing a program like this, finding competitive programming, evaluating the education market needs and tweaking the idea to create a tailored  implementation plan for the product.

I'm working for equity for all students regardless or color, socio-economic status, culture & creed

My project is aimed to create cultural, racial and socio-economic equity in education, college-readiness and entrepreneurship. Incentives for Inquiry is a program aimed to cultivate sustainable and social impact focused communities by empowering future community stakeholders to ask questions with confidence despite environmental barriers. People who are confident asking questions are better decision-makers and leaders. They are also more likely to create pathways for themselves and others.

The journey will allow me to tell their stories and mine

I plan to write a book about my business journey and share pictures, quotes and statistical evidence through social media and my blog. After the journey, I plan to create an executable pilot to start in the DC metro area. I intend to launch the pilot in the Winter of 2016.

Note:
If my campaign is among the first 20 to reach its $5,000 goal, all funds raised will go to MTP, which is a 501(c)3 organization. As such, they will be tax-deductible. These funds help to underwrite the costs of the journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs. If I am not among the first 20 applicants to reach their crowdfunding goal, none of my supporters will be charged.

story:
Your New Favorite One-Stop STEM Shop!

You can now buy all our products from anywhere in the world from our online store! Visit HERE to get your favorite kits.

Codeavour - Coding Contest for Kids

We're happy to announce that we're organizing a worldwide online coding content for kids - Codeavour 2019. Registrations for the contest are OPEN and are FREE. The last date to enter is 20 September 2019. You can learn more about the contest HERE.

Pictoblox - Newer. Smarter. Smoother.

We've launched the latest version of PictoBlox, v1.0.8, which now allows you to work with prototyping platforms other than evive such as ESP32. Dedicated extensions for the 4-axis Robotic Arm and making a Humanoid Robot along with support for complex actuators like the A4988 driver stepper motor, 28BYJ-48 stepper motor, and MPU6050 sensor has also been incorporated.

You can download the latest version from HERE.

Dabble - Taking Project Making to New Heights

We constantly keep making Dabble better and better to make project-making seamless.

You can now download its latest version from HERE.

STEMpedia is a go-to platform for everything you need to get creative. Learn the basics of new-age tech, build countless projects, program robots, and don’t you ever, ever try to step back from being the innovator you’re destined to be!

All-in-one DIYing package with everything one needs to get creative.

One kit - countless projects

Make hundreds of projects using the evive Starter Kit 2.0 - with the most intuitive prototyping device, versatile mechanical & electronic components, and Young Makers’ Guide.

Learn with engaging online courses

Uncover the ‘hows’ and ‘whys’ of electronics, programming, and robotics through learning-by-doing in an engaging series of three online courses - the STEM Safari.

Code. Play. Repeat.

Code with our Scratch 3.0-based graphical interface- PictoBlox, make interactive games and animations, and make your robots dance to your tune. Drag ‘n’ drop. Rock ‘n’ roll ;)

Interact with your projects wirelessly

Wirelessly control your robots, stream feedback and exploit sensor data such as GPS, mic, and camera with our smartphone app- Dabble, to make your projects more versatile.

 

It's not just another package - with evive itself packing built-in features worth over $300; plus the additional components; plus online courses, PictoBlox, Dabble, tons of free resources and what not - it’s the best deal you are ever going to get! See for yourself!

The global technology landscape is moving much faster than our education system can cope, consequently, it becomes our responsibility to help young minds develop 21st-century skills.  

Affirmations from Numerous DIYers

Have a look at what they have to say:

evive - The Best Prototyping Device

With built-in features worth over $300, it's versatile, dynamic, and ageless.

STEM Safari - Online Courses

Three courses - limitless learning - electronics, programming, and robotics made fun.

Dabble - One App. Infinite Control.

Tons of features, giving you complete control over your creations

iOS Application is under development and will be launched soon,

 

Young Makers' Guide - A Book of DIY Projects

A self-explanatory project-making book through the peninsula of DIYing

Learning Resources for Free

Add-on Kits

Gardening Kit: Add-on kit to make agriculture and home-garden projects like Plant Monitoring System, Drip Irrigation System, Wireless Irrigation Control, Automated Plant Watering System, Plant Lighting System, Soil pH Monitoring, Solar Energy Harvesting etc., allowing students to understand the much-needed sector.

IoT Kit: Add-on package with wireless communication modules, sensors, relays etc. to make internet of things and home automation projects like human motion detection, measuring temperature & humidity, password protecting your door lock, controlling home appliances like lights, fans, TV and posting data to social media etc.

Robotic Arm Kit: Add-on package with mechanical and electronic components to make robotic manipulators like a pick-and-place system, sketching robot etc.

A True One-Stop Solution

It’s not a product; it’s an ecosystem.

Note: Classroom training programs are not available globally, if you want us to bring them to your country, please drop us a request at contact@thestempedia.com.

STEMpedia Starter Package

Combination Kits

Add-on Kits

In addition to these awesome hardworking people, we have the following people to thank:

धन्यवाद् | We couldn’t be any more grateful to you for believing in us! Now all you have to do is sit back, relax, and get ready for the exciting journey that we’re going to take you on!

In case you have any queries or if you just want to say Hi, drop us a mail at support@thestempedia.com.

1. The evive Starter Kit 2.0 is already into production and has undergone a small batch production to understand and mitigate production and supply chain challenges.

2. The STEM Safari is at 80% completion. Courses on Electronics and Robotics are complete while the course on Programming is still under development. While the content, quizzes, assessments etc. for the course on Programming are complete, videos are yet to be shot, edited and uploaded to the course.

3. PictoBlox has been released as an Alpha for the purpose of demonstrations and gathering reviews for this campaign. We are adding a few more features and making it more stable so as to release the final version by the time of shipping.

4. We released the alpha for the  Android version of Dabble app in Dec 2018, so as to gather reviews and suggestions for improvements. The team is currently working on making such improvements and developing the iOS version for Dabble.

All the constituents are at a stage where they are 2-4 weeks away from stable releases.

This being our second campaign (the first one was on Indiegogo way back in 2016), we are well aware of the risks and challenges of crowdfunding. So this time, we’ve taken extra care and finished off almost everything prior to launching the campaign. We have done a small manufacturing run already to understand and resolve manufacturing challenges, have a decent stock of over 250 units, as a result, are confident of our unit economics, have on-boarded FedEx as our shipping partner, have released stable versions of software, application, online courses etc. For further production, we have the capacity of producing 300-1000 units in a 45-day production run. In short, the team is well aware of what it is promising and is determined to deliver. You can shed your worries and hop on the journey with us :) 
We have given you a conservative timeline anyway, factoring in 2-3 weeks of delay in potential bottle-necks already. Despite all of this, if a glitch creeps in, however small, we will keep you updated. Because all that matters, in the end, is that we are able to fulfill our promise and deliver on schedule. 
We are happy to launch STEMpedia on Indiegogo and are very much looking forward to having you as our very first batch of consumers. Let us realize the dream of an innovative tomorrow driven by young minds of the present.

Thank you.

Your friends @ STEMpedia.
story_txt:
Your New Favorite One-Stop STEM Shop!You can now buy all our products from anywhere in the world from our online store! Visit HERE to get your favorite kits.Codeavour - Coding Contest for KidsWe're happy to announce that we're organizing a worldwide online coding content for kids - Codeavour 2019. Registrations for the contest are OPEN and are FREE. The last date to enter is 20 September 2019. You can learn more about the contest HERE.Pictoblox - Newer. Smarter. Smoother.We've launched the latest version of PictoBlox, v1.0.8, which now allows you to work with prototyping platforms other than evive such as ESP32. Dedicated extensions for the 4-axis Robotic Arm and making a Humanoid Robot along with support for complex actuators like the A4988 driver stepper motor, 28BYJ-48 stepper motor, and MPU6050 sensor has also been incorporated.You can download the latest version from HERE.Dabble - Taking Project Making to New HeightsWe constantly keep making Dabble better and better to make project-making seamless.You can now download its latest version from HERE.STEMpedia is a go-to platform for everything you need to get creative. Learn the basics of new-age tech, build countless projects, program robots, and don’t you ever, ever try to step back from being the innovator you’re destined to be!





All-in-one DIYing package with everything one needs to get creative.
One kit - countless projects
Make hundreds of projects using the evive Starter Kit 2.0 - with the most intuitive prototyping device, versatile mechanical & electronic components, and Young Makers’ Guide.

Learn with engaging online courses
Uncover the ‘hows’ and ‘whys’ of electronics, programming, and robotics through learning-by-doing in an engaging series of three online courses - the STEM Safari.

Code. Play. Repeat.
Code with our Scratch 3.0-based graphical interface- PictoBlox, make interactive games and animations, and make your robots dance to your tune. Drag ‘n’ drop. Rock ‘n’ roll ;)

Interact with your projects wirelessly
Wirelessly control your robots, stream feedback and exploit sensor data such as GPS, mic, and camera with our smartphone app- Dabble, to make your projects more versatile.













 


It's not just another package - with evive itself packing built-in features worth over $300; plus the additional components; plus online courses, PictoBlox, Dabble, tons of free resources and what not - it’s the best deal you are ever going to get! See for yourself!


The global technology landscape is moving much faster than our education system can cope, consequently, it becomes our responsibility to help young minds develop 21st-century skills.  


Affirmations from Numerous DIYers
Have a look at what they have to say:

evive - The Best Prototyping Device
With built-in features worth over $300, it's versatile, dynamic, and ageless.

STEM Safari - Online Courses
Three courses - limitless learning - electronics, programming, and robotics made fun.


Dabble - One App. Infinite Control.
Tons of features, giving you complete control over your creations

iOS Application is under development and will be launched soon,
 
Young Makers' Guide - A Book of DIY Projects
A self-explanatory project-making book through the peninsula of DIYing

Learning Resources for Free



Add-on Kits
Gardening Kit: Add-on kit to make agriculture and home-garden projects like Plant Monitoring System, Drip Irrigation System, Wireless Irrigation Control, Automated Plant Watering System, Plant Lighting System, Soil pH Monitoring, Solar Energy Harvesting etc., allowing students to understand the much-needed sector.

IoT Kit: Add-on package with wireless communication modules, sensors, relays etc. to make internet of things and home automation projects like human motion detection, measuring temperature & humidity, password protecting your door lock, controlling home appliances like lights, fans, TV and posting data to social media etc.

Robotic Arm Kit: Add-on package with mechanical and electronic components to make robotic manipulators like a pick-and-place system, sketching robot etc.

A True One-Stop Solution
It’s not a product; it’s an ecosystem.

Note: Classroom training programs are not available globally, if you want us to bring them to your country, please drop us a request at contact@thestempedia.com.

STEMpedia Starter Package




Combination Kits



Add-on Kits









In addition to these awesome hardworking people, we have the following people to thank:


धन्यवाद् | We couldn’t be any more grateful to you for believing in us! Now all you have to do is sit back, relax, and get ready for the exciting journey that we’re going to take you on!
In case you have any queries or if you just want to say Hi, drop us a mail at support@thestempedia.com.

story:
THE SITUATION

Mozambique is one of the least educated countries in Africa with hundreds of small communities that need social and educational infrastructure.

Morrumbene is a small village in the Inhambane province in the south of the country, which is increasingly lacking in public spaces. This lack of public space causes children to focus their energy on technology changing social behavior resulting in a loss to the real world.

We had the opportunity to revitalize the garden that unfortunately is being misused and allow the children to enjoy it again.

It is from the recreational activities that a child discovers, develop various skills, greater interaction with the environment in which they live and with others. This interaction is essential for children's physical and mental health and is fundamental to a harmonious society.

THE PROJECT

The Project links the three basic principles of Sustainability:

Reduce costs by looking for cheaper solutions (Economy) through the use of recyclable and environmentally friendly materials, tires and bamboo, both materials easily obtainable in the region acting as pillars of the project (Low environmental impact). The project brings a crucial component to the villagers characterized by the union of the population working on the projection and construction of the Garden (Social).

SPACES

The garden environments can be subdivided into:

WHERE DOES YOUR CONTRIBUTION GO?

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

The Garden Revitalization Project  offers an educational, recreational and leisure space, and is open to all citizens, Schools, NGOs and the community in general, contributing with ideas and participation. In this way, sign up from our e-mail or send messages with a proposal that can contribute to the making of this project.

Email: info@arquitectovino.com       Contact: +258 847599643

If you do not have an online account you can transfer nationally through the Garden Revitalization account

Account number:

BIM - 404 434 517                 BCI - 13456528810001              Mpesa: +258 847599643

Please help us spread the word!  Tell your family and friends about us and share this campaign on Facebook and other social media

PROJECT PHASES

In the first phase of the project we made the diagnosis of the current situation of the Garden and the surroundings. Second, began the design process with the community. Third, all the materials and activities were registered to have a total budget  of the garden to enable us to raise funds through social networking and local events,  and finally to team up with the community to rebuild and maintain the garden that will be complete in the end of July 2018.

Discussing with the community

OUR TEAM

WWW.ARQUITECTOVINO.COM

Arquitecto Vino is a collective of architects, physical planners, engineers and artists based in the province of Inhambane, which aim to help in improving local communities, contributing to the development of the country. We believe in simple architecture opening doors to an understanding of the natural world as well as modern.

YOU CAN BE ASKING

1- Is this the first project?

No, but it's the first project involving the local community. After working in the Estudio 5 architects, having held 2 theaters festivals in the city of Maputo using recyclable materials that covered about 500 users. During the same trajectory, we did an experiment collecting empty PET bottles with street children, with the aim of learning and teaching how to reuse bottles, helping to develop a creative mind. Also, we do housing projects, always integrating ecological materials.

2-What will happen if the campaign does not reach the goal?

We will be determined to prove that it is worth pursuing the dreams we believe in. We will carry out the garden project with the help we can get.

3-What is the motive?

Our main focus is education and health of children. We believe that the development of a country is in the hands of the new generation.

The objective is to bring children closer to nature to change the direction of their thinking, to give them such attention is because they are imaginative and quick learners. Teaching early sustainability concepts for children is an important task. And with simple examples, we can have effects that will last throughout your life.

REWARD

By Donating 160USD, you will get a  Garden Revitalization T-Shirt  and web recognition and email updates on the construction of the Garden! We will also keep you posted on special events & workshops happening at the site.

If you prefer to receive a t-shirt with the tagline in English, just let us know.

Thank you

PORTUGUÊS

 

SITUAÇÃO ACTUAL

Moçambique é um dos países com menos recursos educacionais em África, com centenas de pequenas comunidades, que precisam de infraestruturas sociais e educacionais.

Morrumbene, é uma pequena vila, localizada na província de Inhambane, no sul do País, que está cada vez mais carente de áreas públicas, consequência das novas tecnologias e trabalho infantil que têm mudado o comportamento social resultando numa perda ao mundo real por parte das crianças.

Para trazer frente a este cenário, tivemos a oportunidade de revitalizar o jardim que infelizmente está a ser mal aproveitado e entregar de volta o verdadeiro mundo de diversão das crianças.

É apartir das actividades recreativas que a criança sente-se instigada pelas descobertas, desenvolvendo várias habilidades, maior interacção com o meio em que vive e com os outros, apreendendo a difícil tarefa de viver colectivamente. Essa interacção é essencial para saúde física e mental das crianças e fundamental para uma sociedade harmoniosa.

O PROJECTO

O Projecto vem ligar os três princípios básicos da Sustentabilidade:

Reduzir os custos, procurando soluções mais baratas (Economia), através de uso de materiais recicláveis e ecológicos, pneus e bamboo, ambos materiais de fácil obtenção na região actuando como pilares do projecto (Baixo impacto ambiental). O projecto traz uma componente crucial para os moradores da vila caracterizado pela união da população trabalhando na projecção e construção do Jardim (Social).

ONDE SUA CONTRIBUIÇÃO VAI?

COMO MAIS PODE AJUDAR?

O Projecto da Revitalização do Jardim, por oferecer um espaço educativo, recreativo e de lazer, é aberto para todos cidadãos, as escolas, ONGSs e comunidade em geral, contribuindo com ideias e participação. Deste modo, inscreva-se a partir do nosso e-mail ou enviando mensagens com uma proposta capaz de contribuir para realização deste projecto.

Email: info@arquitectovino.com       Contacto: +258 847599643

Se não tiver conta online pode transferir nacionalmente através da conta destinada à Revitalização do Jardim

N° da conta: 

404 434 517 BIM                         13456528810001 BCI                      Mpesa: +258 847599643

 

Por favor, ajude-nos a espalhar a palavra! Informe a sua família e amigos sobre nós e compartilhe esta campanha no Facebook e outras redes sociais.

FASES DO PROJECTO

Na primeira fase do projecto fez-se diagnóstico da situação actual do Jardim e a envolvente. De seguida começou-se o processo do design com a comunidade. Em terceiro lugar, foram registados todos os materiais necessários para ter um orçamento total do jardim com a finalidade de arrecadar fundos através de redes sociais e eventos locais, e por fim formar uma equipe com a comunidade para reconstruir e manter o jardim que estará completo nos finais de Julho de 2018.

NOSSA EQUIPE

WWW.ARQUITECTOVINO.VOM

Arquitecto Vino é um colectivo de arquitectos, planificadores físicos, engenheiros e artistas com sede na província de Inhambane, que visa ajudar no melhoramento das comunidades locais, contribuindo para o desenvolvimento do país. Acreditamos em uma arquitectura simples e sensível abrindo portas a uma compreensão do Natural e exploração do Moderno.

PODE ESTAR PERGUNTANDO-SE

1-Este é o primeiro projecto?

Não, mas é o primeiro projecto envolvendo a comunidade local. Depois de trabalhar no estúdio 5 arquitectos, tendo realizado 2 cinemas festivais na cidade de Maputo usando materiais recicláveis que abrangiu cerca de 500 utentes. Durante a mesma trajectória, fizemos uma experiência coleccionando garrafas PET vazia junto à crianças da rua, com objectivo de apreender e ensinar como reutilizar garrafas, ajudando a desenvolver uma mente criativa. E também, fazemos projectos habitacionais, sempre integrando os materiais ecológicos.

2-O que acontecerá se a campanha não atingir o objectivo?

Nos manteremos determinados a provar que vale a pena perseguir os sonhos em que acreditamos. Realizaremos o projecto do Jardim com a ajuda que conseguirmos.

3-Qual é​ o motivo?

O nosso foco principal é a educação e a saúde das crianças. Nós acreditamos que o desenvolvimento de um país está nas mãos da nova geração.

Tem se como objectivo a aproximação das crianças à natureza para mudar a direcção do pensar das mesmas , ter a maior atenção nelas porque elas são puras e aprendizes rápidas. Ensinar, desde cedo, conceitos de sustentabilidade para a crianças é uma tarefa importante. E com exemplos simples, podemos ter efeitos que durarão por toda sua vida.

REDES SOCIAIS

story:
Your contribution can literally change the lives of children! 

Hello! Pam here, founder of Respectful Ways.

It all started with a personal experience of being cyber-bullied.  
The struggle helped me understand how children who've been victimized can feel disheartened and beaten up. It drove home that our biggest need today is learning - and practicing - kindness and respect. I focused my energy on helping schools and children.

About a year and a half ago a Principal told me, "You know Pam, we love your engaging classroom signs, but we need curriculum around the positive messaging. We want a program." My mind exploded with ideas on how to turn my positive messaging slogans into a full-fledged character education curriculum.

As an Emmy and Peabody award-winning Journalist, I put my reporter's cap back on and produced this social and emotional program like a newsroom by hiring professional curriculum writers and educators, designing graphics and animations, and bringing on business consultants to make an amazing new character curriculum! 

I can not tell you how many times I've heard from educators, "There's nothing out there like this Pam."  Of course we have competition, but they've been around for 20 or 30 years, and often use 3-ring binders and videos as their talking points. 

We are an online curriculum that uses pop-culture trends  such as rhymes, slogans, and emojis to engage and capture the hearts of children. The interactive, animated courses help educators teach children CPR: Compassion, Perseverance, Respect and Responsibility. Our two Advisory Boards have helped guide our programming, and we've made it into two schools so far!

Here's a story that is sadly heartbreaking, yet also proves just how powerful an online learning program can be. 

Our first pilot school in Newark was closed by New Jersey Governor Chris Christie within weeks of them adopting Respectful Ways. This was a surprise to even the Principal who found out about the Governor's plan to close his school via the media. We immediately called to action and wrote new curriculum for their students to learn formal letter writing skills. I called the Principal, asked him to hit refresh on his computer, and voila! They had brand new curriculum for their students to learn perseverance and respectful reactions (and we also fulfilled a good number of common core standards!) They mailed their letters to the Governor, but sadly, that charter school was still closed by the state. 

But we here at Respectful Ways persevered! We were able to find a new school to pilot our program.

The children love Respectful Ways!  School Counselor Latoria Hairston recently told us, "The students really enjoy the activities. I feel that they really make them aware of what respect does, and can, look like."

With all this good, comes the troubling truth.

We've run out of money to finish writing the last of the curriculum and finish building the online delivery system. 

Your contribution can literally change the lives of children! 

It takes a village and a program like this helps parents and educators teach social and emotional skills. Kids need daily and weekly reminders to understand CPR: Compassion, Perseverance, Respect & Responsibility.

I literally did the math and am asking for exactly what we need to finish the curriculum  in order to pay 5 to 6 staff members, times the # of hours they'll work a week, times 4 weeks a month, times the # of months before the 2018/19 school year begins. We WILL complete this monster task, with your help. Thank you in advance!

(Watch the video to see how I was able to self-fund Respectful Ways the first year of development!)

Indiegogo Perks are wonderful and we'd love to spread the good word  so please let us know which school or after-school program you'd like to see receive Respectful Ways curriculum. We'll be in touch with their Principal or Director, let them know the passwords, and train their staff on how to use the online curriculum. This is so exciting to think about! Thank you again!

Learning social skills and understanding emotions doesn't always come naturally to young people. **With these indiegogo perks, you will literally get to see and hear about the impact Respectful Ways has had on the students that you helped through your donation.

We understand if you can't help monetarily, but you never know who you know, knows. Your friend's aunt may be a Principal of a school, or your neighbor may have a wealthy relative who believes in giving back to children. Please help us spread the word to people who are:

  • 1) discouraged by disrespect
  • 2) support philanthropic programs
  • 3) believe in character education for children or
  • 4) work in the education industry

I have never worked harder in my life y'all. We here at Respectful Ways find this to be one of the most rewarding projects we've ever worked on. Now let's get back to work! --> Thanks to you.

If you'd like to connect, email me at Pam@RespectfulWays.com

Respectful Ways is ~ HumanKIND Curriculum to Educate the Human Heart. 

Wish us luck! ~ And thank you for supporting this amazing curriculum! :-) 

~Pam McNall, Founder, RespectfulWays.com
story_txt:
Your contribution can literally change the lives of children! Hello! Pam here, founder of Respectful Ways.It all started with a personal experience of being cyber-bullied.  The struggle helped me understand how children who've been victimized can feel disheartened and beaten up. It drove home that our biggest need today is learning - and practicing - kindness and respect. I focused my energy on helping schools and children.About a year and a half ago a Principal told me, "You know Pam, we love your engaging classroom signs, but we need curriculum around the positive messaging. We want a program." My mind exploded with ideas on how to turn my positive messaging slogans into a full-fledged character education curriculum.As an Emmy and Peabody award-winning Journalist, I put my reporter's cap back on and produced this social and emotional program like a newsroom by hiring professional curriculum writers and educators, designing graphics and animations, and bringing on business consultants to make an amazing new character curriculum! I can not tell you how many times I've heard from educators, "There's nothing out there like this Pam."  Of course we have competition, but they've been around for 20 or 30 years, and often use 3-ring binders and videos as their talking points. We are an online curriculum that uses pop-culture trends  such as rhymes, slogans, and emojis to engage and capture the hearts of children. The interactive, animated courses help educators teach children CPR: Compassion, Perseverance, Respect and Responsibility. Our two Advisory Boards have helped guide our programming, and we've made it into two schools so far!
Here's a story that is sadly heartbreaking, yet also proves just how powerful an online learning program can be. Our first pilot school in Newark was closed by New Jersey Governor Chris Christie within weeks of them adopting Respectful Ways. This was a surprise to even the Principal who found out about the Governor's plan to close his school via the media. We immediately called to action and wrote new curriculum for their students to learn formal letter writing skills. I called the Principal, asked him to hit refresh on his computer, and voila! They had brand new curriculum for their students to learn perseverance and respectful reactions (and we also fulfilled a good number of common core standards!) They mailed their letters to the Governor, but sadly, that charter school was still closed by the state. But we here at Respectful Ways persevered! We were able to find a new school to pilot our program.The children love Respectful Ways!  School Counselor Latoria Hairston recently told us, "The students really enjoy the activities. I feel that they really make them aware of what respect does, and can, look like."With all this good, comes the troubling truth.We've run out of money to finish writing the last of the curriculum and finish building the online delivery system. Your contribution can literally change the lives of children!  It takes a village and a program like this helps parents and educators teach social and emotional skills. Kids need daily and weekly reminders to understand CPR: Compassion, Perseverance, Respect & Responsibility.I literally did the math and am asking for exactly what we need to finish the curriculum  in order to pay 5 to 6 staff members, times the # of hours they'll work a week, times 4 weeks a month, times the # of months before the 2018/19 school year begins. We WILL complete this monster task, with your help. Thank you in advance!(Watch the video to see how I was able to self-fund Respectful Ways the first year of development!)Indiegogo Perks are wonderful and we'd love to spread the good word  so please let us know which school or after-school program you'd like to see receive Respectful Ways curriculum. We'll be in touch with their Principal or Director, let them know the passwords, and train their staff on how to use the online curriculum. This is so exciting to think about! Thank you again!Learning social skills and understanding emotions doesn't always come naturally to young people. **With these indiegogo perks, you will literally get to see and hear about the impact Respectful Ways has had on the students that you helped through your donation.We understand if you can't help monetarily, but you never know who you know, knows. Your friend's aunt may be a Principal of a school, or your neighbor may have a wealthy relative who believes in giving back to children. Please help us spread the word to people who are:
1) discouraged by disrespect
2) support philanthropic programs
3) believe in character education for children or
4) work in the education industry
I have never worked harder in my life y'all. We here at Respectful Ways find this to be one of the most rewarding projects we've ever worked on. Now let's get back to work! --> Thanks to you.If you'd like to connect, email me at Pam@RespectfulWays.comRespectful Ways is ~ HumanKIND Curriculum to Educate the Human Heart. Wish us luck! ~ And thank you for supporting this amazing curriculum! :-) ~Pam McNall, Founder, RespectfulWays.com

story:
We are BAUDL. The Bay Area Urban Debate League.  

We partner with schools throughout the San Francisco Bay Area to found debate teams and transform the lives of students that traditional classrooms fail to engage. Over the past three years, we have doubled in size, touching hundreds of students across the Bay Area and have helped helped countless individuals reverse their trajectory from low expectations to high performance.  The young people we serve are more than 95% students of color, and the great majority live in poverty. Nationally, less than half of low-income high school seniors make it to college, and rates are even worse in the under-resourced public schools we serve. In contrast, 96% of BAUDL seniors graduate high school and fully 86% go on to college. 

What is the BAUDL 500?

The BAUDL 500 is our campaign to reach 500 donors by January 1, 2012.  Over the past couple years, we have learned to maximize the leverage of every private dollar we receive and the BAUDL 500 is no exception.  We have a donor ready to match your money with $10,000 if we can find 500 people to give at least $20 this calendar year - we are already at 210, and need your help to get the rest of the way.

To be completely honest, $20,000 would be life-changing for our program and the students it reaches.  And $20?  Probably not too much to sacrifice to give these amazing young people a leg up.

The Impact

The opportunities are endless if we are able to achieve this goal.   What does your donation do and what happens if we achieve our targeted goal?  

Your small donation counts:

  • A gift of $20 makes a Supply Pack. It gives a single student the tools they need to compete - files, timers, tubs to store the evidence they research by hand, and more.
  • A gift of $50 funds a Mega Novice Workshop. Here, we roll onto campus with pizza, evidence packs, and enthusiasm to get new recruits pumped about the life of the mind.
  • A gift of $100 enables Tournament Travel. This gets a team of students out to a tournament who otherwise couldn't make it, helping them their skills against some of the brightest minds in the Bay Area. 
  • A gift of $200 provides a Summer Lab Pack, equipping 20 young people with all the gear they need to begin their lives as debaters at our annual Summer Institute.

But let's be real, big donations count even more:

  • A gift of $500 funds a Youth Debater for an entire year, opening up an intellectual world for them, making it possible for them to practice, attend workshops, roll out to tournaments, and build strong voices through debate. 
  • A gift of $1,000 is a Weekend Workshop. Your gift would make it possible for dozens of students gather to research and discuss the most important issues of the day.
  • A gift of $2,500 supports a Debate Coach. The heart and soul of this movement lies in its teachers, who give so much to their students.
  • A gift of $5,000 is a BAUDL Tournament. This is our signature event, bringing more than a hundred people together to support the voices and brilliance of underserved young people. 

If we reach 500 donors, we'll do all of the above AND earn the $10K match.  Then we can:

  • Finance our BAUDL Traveling Team.  Every Friday debaters stream from all our campuses to the BAUDL office to talk high-level strategy and research. Their dream is to compete at the highest level nationally - and we want to help make that dream real. Leveling the playing field for our students to compete with some of the most prestigious private schools around the country is an eye-opening opportunity that makes anything possible in the eyes of the student.  When students are able to surround themselves with this level of talent and competition they realize that anything is possible.

Spread the word

The BAUDL wasn't built off of limitless cash, rather the hard work and passion of it's volunteers, advocates and staff. We need your time, energy and interest in helping as much as anything else. Below are three things you can do even if you are unable to donate:

  1. Like Us On Facebook:  Surprisingly, we've been connected with numerous former debaters who have something great to offer through your social networks.   Help us spread the word by "Liking" us on Facebook.  (http://www.facebook.com/BayDebate)
  2. Email 5 Friends:  That's right...Good Ole Word of Mouth!   We'd love to have you as an advocate.  If you can't donate, but feel like the BAUDL is a worthy cause, please pass of the good word on and let your friends know for us. 
  3. Donate Your Time:  We're always looking for individuals in the surrounding Bay Area to get involved in our tournaments and our programming.   We'd love to have you as a judge, where you can experience the impact this program has on the students most directly by evaluating their performance.   We'll teach you everything you need to know and I promise, it will be one of the most rewarding experience you could imagine.   Email us at: info@baudl.org if you're interested. 


Thanks For Your Support!

story:
Fraulein Dummkopf?

Educated in the Louisiana school system, it's a wonder that Brittany has made it this far. While completing her doctoral studies, Brittany was asked to present some of her groundbreaking research, per Oprah, at the largest sexology conference in the world, in Munich. Excited by this opportunity, Brittany began planning all of the fun things she could do in France. She had always longed to visit the Louvre. When sadly informed that Munich was in Germany, Brittany realized that she had a lot of learning yet to do. Not dismayed by her own idiot-savantism, Brittany is determined to get to Germany, present her research, make a contribution to the sex-positive literature, eat a gluten-free Bratwurst and find out where the hell Munich is. Topography may not be her bag...but bagging' sure is!


Dr. Ruth Jr.

Sex sex sex...seriously. I have been working as a researcher and educator in the field of sexology for 10 years, and I am beyond pleased I have been invited to offer a perspective previously omitted from the academic field of vision.  My research has taken many forms over the years, but has always included the intent to move the field away from debasing, and focusing on the "novelty" aspect of alternative sexual behaviors (BDSM-leather, fetish, swing, polyamory).  I welcome the opportunity to bring the underground into respected discourse, to help my gifted colleagues look at this wealth of information with a fresh set of eyes, to stop underestimating the power of things that are talked about in whispers. 

This particular body of research focuses on the therapeutic benefits of BDSM engagment, specifically improvement with overall sexual satisfaction, body acceptance, sexual knowledge and communication among female survivors of sexual assault. This work came in response to several late 90's studies connecting high levels of "sex guilt" and "non-accepted sexual behavior" (BDSM-leather, fetish, swing,and polyamory) to female survivors of sexual assault. I hope this current work can challenge this outdated, pejorative perspective, and expand the way we view sexual healing!!

The field is ready to grow up and celebrate, instead of denigrate, the wide range of sexualities, and acknowledge the legitimate impact alternate expressions of sexuality can have on one's overall health, sense of self, boundaries and empowerment; shifting our view to see this as a hopeful road for healing. It's time to root for the underdog.

As it turns out, I'm kind of a big deal. I'm finishing a Ph.d program which is the end of a very long, very dear process to me. I began my graduate studies in 2004 in a biopsychology doctoral program where I was supposedly studying human sexualityâ€¦by replicating archaic brain lesion studiesâ€¦on rats. One night, after sitting for several hours in the dark watching an obese female rat unsuccessful try to mount her male counterpart for the thousandth time, I wondered what the hell happened to my passion? What contribution would my excessive knowledge of rat porn make to the way people relate to their bodies and each others? And, gosh, it's hard to get excited when my only connection to my calling involves me staring at rotund, sexually extroverted, rodents. So I left. I found a different path, one that put me in a position to expand my own horizons. This process has been equal parts passion and pain. I truly would appreciate your support in helping me present this work with integrity, and honoring my own personal accomplishment.  I've made it to the olympics of sexology!!! 

What We Need & What You Get

The majority of your gracious donations will go toward my plane ticket, housing, and food (how do you say "gluten-free" in German?). The rest of the money will be used to provide financial stipends to some of the research particpants who allowed their stories to be taped and used in the presentation. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough all around, so if you cannot give financially, I ask you to remember that the size of your life is decided by an attitude of non-acceptance; this becomes the edge of your world. Please always be aware if your fears, attitudes, beliefs, past, etc limit the size of your world and the people in it.

story:
Our Story

For the past four months the group of North American volunteers on the Yahel Social Change Program have been living and working in Shapira, an Ethiopian-Israeli neighborhood in Gedera, Israel. Our main volunteer work has been in collaboration with a local community empowerment organization called Friends by Nature, or Haverim B’Teva in Hebrew. Most of our activities include tutoring English through the “Homework at Home" program, directing hiking and leadership youth groups, and building community gardens.


As part of our program, we identified needs in the community and developed a couple of different projects to attend to those needs.  One of the main things we saw was that there is little programming and activities for the younger kids in the neighborhood.  Most of the kids spend all afternoon and evening outside playing in the street with little supervision.  In the past, Friends by Nature has run a summer camp for children in the Shapira neighborhood.  However, this year there was not enough of a budget or enough counselors to facilitate a camp.  We decided to take on the summer camp as our project.



The Impact

The Shapira Summer Camp is the perfect time for children who would otherwise be playing in the street, to have a positive first experience in the Shapira youth center.  We are, essentially, providing the manpower and resources for the Friends by Nature camp.  Because of this, Friends by Nature is giving us a budget, however the budget only covers minimal resources. We need to raise money so that we can provide a professional, well-organized, and engaging experience.


One of our goals for the camp is that the campers come out of the experience with a higher confidence and familiarity with English vocabulary.  In order to do this, we need art and game supplies so that we can facilitate engaging English activities.  It is very difficult for us to ensure that the kids who come the first day will continue coming to camp until the end and will feel that they are part of a group.  To make sure this happens, we also want to include activities such as: a pool day, camp tye-dye, a treasure hunt, a movie, and camp t-shirts.



What We Need & What You Get

In order to run a successful summer camp, we need $500 for resources and programming expenses. 

All the funds we raise will go directly towards recruitment efforts (fliers, posters, writing supplies) and programming resources (art supplies, games, snacks, pool access, and t-shirts).


$5--Snacks for One Day of Camp

$10--Art Supplies for Five Campers

$30--Camp T-shirts for Five Campers

$50--Sponsor Pool Day for Five Campers

$100--Sponsor One Counselor-In-Training


Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution, big or small, can help us reach our goal to run an English-based Summer Camp in the Shapira neighborhood! Please help us spread the word and pass along information to your family and friends!


Also, if you live in Israel and have art supplies, games, or books (in Hebrew or English) they would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
NYC Chinatown Food Festival is ...

A free-admission open to public street festival welcoming locals and tourists to enjoy a day in NYC Chinatown.  Public samples $1/$2 delicious food plates and products offered by the neighborhood.  

Who's Behind it

As the producer of the NYC Taste of Chinatown 5 years ago, the event ceased as the required funding for the ExploreChinatown campaign was gone.  As we team up with volunteers to bring back the event, we'd need the funding in order to make it happen.  

Why?

With disappointment from the community organizations and lack of commitment, there is no foresee recreation and marketing program that can bring large sum of foot traffic to promote the area. Slowly, NYC Chinatown is turning to a rusted gem.  

Uniquely comprised of many small businesses, the neighborhood needs to bring back tourists to spend and enjoy in the area before it turns to a dead city, as well as the locals to help support and restore the unique culture.

For The Event Comers:

  • sample tasting delicious food plates offered by 50+ restaurants
  • shop at unique stores in discounted price
  • enjoy cultural performance and hip entertainments
  • get to know the uniqueness of NYC Chinatown and be excited about it

What We Need

As a volunteering team, our goal is to raise at least $85,000.  So as to pay for the necessary permit fees to varies agencies (for street closure, sound permits, food permits, Vendor licenses, etc), equipments and tools, tents, tables & chairs rentals, wagon stage, security, sanitation & trash removal, website building, promotional materials and collaterals, decorations, operating expenses and so on.

What You Get

We welcome you to join our event and help with the neighborhood.  We also seek all kinds of sponsorships in varies level.  In return of your generous support, we offer the perks as your pledge level mentioned on the right panel.

Since we aim to host the event in April, should the governmental permits not to be obtained in time, the event will be pushed to October 2013.  Your perks estimated delivery dates will depends on the actual event date, and we will keep updating the fund drive.

The Impact

This is a non-profit event that helps to promote the greatness of NYC Chinatown to the world.  Also for non-regulars, locals and tourists to experience the uniqueness of the neighborhood can offer. Your contribution makes a major difference for us to accomplish the goal, and your love & trust provide us confidence to make it surely happens.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Should it be difficult for you to contribute in monetary terms, you may still help to:

  • Be a volunteer for the event date (please provide your email and contact info, nyctownfood@gmail.com)
  • Send this to contacts and companies you may know who may sponsor this campaign
  • Share & Tweet it!
  • http://igg.me/p/305786/x/2022012
  • https://www.facebook.com/pages/NYC-Chinatown-Food-Festival/392941920795300#
  • https://twitter.com/NYCtownFoodFest

Thank You!

We appreciate you giving the time and attention you already have to read about this project. Every little bit helps. Thanks!
story_txt:
NYC Chinatown Food Festival is ...
A free-admission open to public street festival welcoming locals and tourists to enjoy a day in NYC Chinatown.  Public samples $1/$2 delicious food plates and products offered by the neighborhood.  
Who's Behind it
As the producer of the NYC Taste of Chinatown 5 years ago, the event ceased as the required funding for the ExploreChinatown campaign was gone.  As we team up with volunteers to bring back the event, we'd need the funding in order to make it happen.  
Why?
With disappointment from the community organizations and lack of commitment, there is no foresee recreation and marketing program that can bring large sum of foot traffic to promote the area. Slowly, NYC Chinatown is turning to a rusted gem.  
Uniquely comprised of many small businesses, the neighborhood needs to bring back tourists to spend and enjoy in the area before it turns to a dead city, as well as the locals to help support and restore the unique culture.
For The Event Comers:

sample tasting delicious food plates offered by 50+ restaurants
shop at unique stores in discounted price
enjoy cultural performance and hip entertainments
get to know the uniqueness of NYC Chinatown and be excited about it

What We Need


As a volunteering team, our goal is to raise at least $85,000.  So as to pay for the necessary permit fees to varies agencies (for street closure, sound permits, food permits, Vendor licenses, etc), equipments and tools, tents, tables & chairs rentals, wagon stage, security, sanitation & trash removal, website building, promotional materials and collaterals, decorations, operating expenses and so on.
What You Get
We welcome you to join our event and help with the neighborhood.  We also seek all kinds of sponsorships in varies level.  In return of your generous support, we offer the perks as your pledge level mentioned on the right panel.
Since we aim to host the event in April, should the governmental permits not to be obtained in time, the event will be pushed to October 2013.  Your perks estimated delivery dates will depends on the actual event date, and we will keep updating the fund drive.
The Impact


This is a non-profit event that helps to promote the greatness of NYC Chinatown to the world.  Also for non-regulars, locals and tourists to experience the uniqueness of the neighborhood can offer. Your contribution makes a major difference for us to accomplish the goal, and your love & trust provide us confidence to make it surely happens.  


Other Ways You Can Help
Should it be difficult for you to contribute in monetary terms, you may still help to:

Be a volunteer for the event date (please provide your email and contact info, nyctownfood@gmail.com)
Send this to contacts and companies you may know who may sponsor this campaign
Share & Tweet it!
http://igg.me/p/305786/x/2022012
https://www.facebook.com/pages/NYC-Chinatown-Food-Festival/392941920795300#
https://twitter.com/NYCtownFoodFest

Thank You!
We appreciate you giving the time and attention you already have to read about this project. Every little bit helps. Thanks!

story:
Hello everyone,


My name is Lwam Eyassu and I am a visual communications design major at Northern Kentucky University. I will be visiting the birthplace of my parents, Eritrea, Africa, in May 2013. Although I am first generation American, I am still very connected to Africa herself. Being born and raised in America, I had the opportunity to explore the arts from a young age and pursure them in college. I haven't been to Eritrean in over a decade, and am very happy about my return. Because I haven't been back since 2002, I would like to make this trip one that is filled with purpose, positivity, and oportunity. The way I imagine this being done is through what I am most passionate about: People and the arts. I am making an effort to gather art supplies, whether used or new, to give to the children of Eritrea. Supplies such as paint brushes, water colors, journals, markers, crayons and items that can be used for jewelry making. There are tons of ways to express yourself through the arts, and nothing is limiting when it comes to this.


Photography is a strong way to capture an experience or an individual's spirit. For this trip, I will also collect 100 disposable cameras. I will hand these cameras to the local children in the city, village, and possibly the seaside. The children will have 24 hours to capture anything they wish. The cameras will then be returned, and I will develop them in the states for public viewing by the people I share this city with. The goal is to have locals capture their lives from their own perspectives. To help us understand their world, culture, and every day life and to show us that we are all essentially the same. Too often do we see photographs taken from an outside perspective. here is an opportunity to view a genuine and original point of view. Another reason why I am doing this is to show that human connections are not restricted when it comes to distance. Though the distance between these two cities is roughly 7,200 miles, a person in Cincinnati can still inspire a child in Asmara and vice versa.

To accomplish these goals, I am asking for donations of cameras in addition to art supplies. Disposable cameras are good for a year after the expiration date, so all donations are welcome. As for convenience, I will be more than happy to make trips for picking up supplies anywhere in the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky region. Supplies can also be mailed if you reside outside these areas. Monetary donations are also welcomed, for it will help with the costs of developing the photographs and sending photographic prints back to the children who participated in 100 Voices.

Anything can help. The smallest gestures can have the most impact on someone's life, and possibly inspire them to create greater and bigger things in their future. Letters of inspiration and motivation are also welcomed and enouraged. Feel free to anonymously write a child in Eritrea about what you hope for them, or even share an experience with them that they can learn from. Although the focus of this project is on uplifting African children, I believe inspiration is a two way street. To give the youth of Eritrea inspiration will inevitably give us inspiration in return. For the youth of Africa also have something to offer.

You who are reading this can help me make this trip filled with purpose, positivity and opportunity. Would you help me in inspiring the youth of Africa?

A million thank you's for your time.


Genuinely,

Lwam Eyassu

100dimtsi@gmail.com

story:
Why Shoes?

Rural school children at Adampane Sudharshana Maha Vidyalaya in the village of Adampane, Sri Lanka have to travel several kilometres to get to school each day. After talking to the principal of the school in a family trip in May 2011, we found that many of these children did so barefoot or with cheap, worn flip-flop sandals. Although the students attending grades 1 through 12 of this school are passionate, intelligent, quirky and creative young people, their inability to own a sturdy pair of shoes acts as a major barrier to their school attendance, contributing to the school's high drop-out rates.

A good-quality pair of shoes in Sri Lanka costs only $10 CDN. When realizing that having a pair of shoes is literally the difference between receiving a basic education or not, we are committed to ensuring that this is no longer a barrier.

Our Broader Project

We decided to base our community empowerment plan for Adampane around the village’s main school, Adampane Sudharshana Maha Vidyalaya, where close to 200 students attend classes from Grade 1 to 12 and are fortunate to have a principal & staff who are devoted to attend to every need of it’s student population the best way they can. The majority of the school staff are also from the same rural area.

Our first visit to the school in May, 2011 helped us to understand a myriad of social & economic issues faced by the students everyday as a result of the abject poverty present  in the community. Our relationship with the school was strengthened by the gifts of school supplies we offered to a select group of poor children in the school and a meal for the entire school community. We then determined that in order to change the course of the vicious cycle of poverty, we needed to pick our pilot group of participants from within the senior group of students in the school. The Grade 10 class, which was the highest grade in the school at that time, had 16 students who were preparing to sit for the GCE ordinary level examination in December, 2011. We decided that the change should begin with this group of 16 young men & women, before they too step into the same cruel circumstances that their parents & grandparents currently face in their lives.

How YOU can help

In order to meet our broader goal of combatting the cycles of poverty in Adampane, we need to ensure that these 200 students are able to receive a basic education. And, in order to do that, we need to do everything possible to ensure they stay in school. Our family has already invested in getting a tutor for the classes, so students have a higher chance of excelling in the national exams. However, we need your help in raising money for something so simple - shoes - to ensure that the foundations are in place for these students to be motivated to use their natural talents successfully.

Whether you contribute $10 for a pair of shoes or some spare change, you will be helping keep these children in school. Once we reach our goal, we will be posting photos of the shoe-sizing and shoe delivery to the school on our website, www.empoweronevillage.com.

You can read more about our visits as well as translated biographies of some of these students, written in their own words, on our website: www.empoweronevillage.com


Share our message:

Share this page on twitter with the hashtag #ShoesforAdampane  or support Empower One Village with the hashtag #E1V

story:
I) Short Summary

Hello Indiegogo friends.  My name is Angela Barbash.  I am the Founder and CEO of Reconsider, a Ypsilanti, Michigan-based financial literacy and local investing advocacy group.  Our mission is to reshape and innovate the way we work with, create, and utilize our wealth by scrutinizing the traditional aspects of investing and money management. 

After working in the ‘traditional’ brokerage environment, I had an ‘a ha’ moment after witnessing the devastating financial-related events of 2007-2008.  I realized there had to be a better way.  I realized the financial world was turned on its head and we needed to redefine our financial literacy if, collectively, we want to prosper in the New Economy. 

Our campaign is mission critical.  It is the crucial - and huge - first step towards making Reconsider’s larger vision a reality.  To say that I eat, sleep and breathe this initiative would be grossly understating it!

If you join Reconsider on this journey you will be reshaping and redefining a financial system that increasingly benefits the few at the expense of the many.  You will be creating a better financial future for yourself, your kids, grandkids and great grandkids. 

 

II) What We Need & What You Get

We at Reconsider are seeking $10,000.  So what will Reconsider do with this money?  Great question. 

Essentially this money will allow us to lay the first few bricks in the foundation of our Sustainable Wealth Education Program.

Specifically, we will utilize the funds to pay for the IRS filing fee to become a bonafide 501c3, hire a grant writer to pursue financial literacy foundation grants and, lastly, to set aside some funds for anticipated legal fees.

If we do not reach our desired goal, we will proportionally distribute any funds raised towards the above-mentioned items.

 

III) The Impact

Reconsider has taken the unconventional step of staring down the financial status quo and boldly stating, “this ain’t working.”

We are the voice of the tens or even hundreds of thousands of people who to date have not had one. 

People who have a desire to create a better tomorrow but haven’t had an identifiable start point.  Rallying around this cause will enable all of us to create and support an independent, resilient and sustainable local economy.  

We are guided by our core principals of purpose, innovation and value.  And, perhaps most importantly, something largely absent from the financial world - transparency. 

We do not operate under a cloak of secrecy or in some nebulous universe where the average person can’t comprehend where their money goes.

 

IV) Other Ways You Can Help

We understand times are tough and people have needed to tighten their belts.  Hell, that’s primarily why we started Reconsider!

You can still make a difference.  Help us spread the word both about our campaign and the need for new financial literacy.

Tell your friends.  Tell your enemies.  Tell your co-workers.  Tell your Facebook Friends and Tweeps.  Tell your broker!  Ok, maybe he won’t rejoice in your decision to go against the grain.  Nonetheless, the more people the better.  Our mission is in its infancy but it will eventually affect just about everyone.

We are agents of change but we can’t do it alone.  We believe in the power of collaboration to move our vision forward.  Through education and our collaborative efforts we will transform a grassroots movement into true structural change in the financial services industry.

Take control of your money and your future wealth.  Join us on this journey to create widespread economic freedom in a new financial frontier that will be transparent and sustainable.

Thanks for taking the time to learn about Reconsider.  

 

# # #

story:
About Us

https://www.facebook.com/pages/EPCC-Interior-Design-Student-Organization/291965700826003#!/pages/EPCC-Interior-Design-Student-Organization/291965700826003?sk=page_insights

The Interior Design Student Organization at El Paso Community College is based here in El Paso, Texas.

We are comprised of interior design students who are passionate and determined about furthering our education and learning all we can throughout school and beyond.

This campaign is all about just that. Last year we were able to attend the Hospitality Design Convention in Las Vegas and it proved to be an astounding opportunity for us to learn more about design and experience it first hand. This year we are planning on taking another trip to Neocon in Chicago, Illinois on June 10-13, 2013.

What We Need

We are planning on taking 11 students on this trip. We have estimated the total cost to be approximately $9,000 for travel, hotel, and other expenses. We have been able to raise the bulk of this amount through local fundraising and donations. We still need $2,000 to help pay for:

  • Hotel Costs ($200 a room)
  • Airfare cost  ($500 per student, round trip)
  • Pay for food and daily travel expenses from the hotel to the event site

The Impact

With your help, we can take this trip which will greatly enhance our education and knowledge of the vast world of design.

Without it, we would not be able to send as many students or it would force some of us to pay out of pocket which is not something everyone can afford with the rising costs of tuition, textbooks, and supplies.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to donate at this time, that's okay. You can still help our campaign by spreading the word and liking us on Facebook.

Thank you all!

Alyx Jones,

Interior Design Student Organization

At El Paso Community College

story:
Destination Imagination


DI is a non profit, volunteer led cause driven organization.  Their purpose is to inspire creative imagination and equip students to become the next generation of innovators and leaders.   Global Finals is the culminating event of every Destination Imagination season.  In May more than 1300 teams from 45 states, and 14 countries gather to showcase their challenge solutions. 

Both Hollis Brookline  Middle School (pictured above) and the High School team (pictured below ) took first  place in the New Hampshire State competition!  Both also were recognized with Renaissance Awards for excellence.  They were honored this year with an invitation to attend Global Finals May 20 through 24 in Knoxville, TN. 

THIS ENTHUSIASTIC GROUP IS SEEKING YOUR SUPPORT!


Our goal is to raise $7000 through this campaign to assist in paying for the teams' registration to compete in this prestigious event.



Hollis-Brookline high school team posing after their 1st place announcement!

  

Here's how your donation can help:

  • $1 gets us closer to our goal!
  • $50  funds one child's fee for special events
  • $100 outfits the kids with team shirts
  • $300 ships the teams' props to TN


Our families will pick up travel costs.


If you would prefer to donate by cash or check instead of online, contact :

Anat Eshed    anat.eshed@yahoo.com or

Carol Swanson  mcas95124@yahoo.com


Team Challenge Videos

Here is the middle school challenge 2014 - Going to Extremes:  A scientific challenge where the team had to invent a solution to living in an extreme environment.  They chose to depict a futuristic human population on a nearby planet Gleise 581d. Their F-car and other elements won them a Renaissance Award, and first place in the Regional and State competitions.

Thank You for your support!
