story:
Light House 42

Light House 42 is a developing Retreat and Learning Center stationed in the Argentine Andes, at the 42nd southern parallel, where an international audience will come together to experience Sustainability in action. 

During this past year we have: 

  • defined our vision and mission
  • created our business plan
  • forged collaborative partnerships with well-established locals
  • found and almost completely paid for the BEST property for our project
  • installed an irrigation system
  • gotten our gardens in
  • built green houses
  • completed a tiny dwelling and started on another
  • put in a composting toilet
  • gotten two of our beehives established
  • and so much more

Thus the beginning of our Retreat & Learning Center, Light House 42, whose promise is to empower new paradigm leaders in the global movement toward a sustainable future. 

Check out our Facebook fan page if you'd like to know more about what we've accomplished this past year. 

What good is a community unless it mobilizes to create a positive change in the world?

We are asking friends to take five minutes to check out this campaign, contribute what you can and share with two others who will share it and make a contribution, as well. 

Light House 42 happens effortlessly, for all of us, when we pull together.  

How does this benefit you?  Think Butterfly Effect.

Light House 42’s primary audience is people who are driven to make a difference, and want the clarity and courage they need to begin. 

Have you noticed things are changing, and realized yesterday’s solutions aren’t really working? Maybe you know there’s something important for you to do, but you’re not sure exactly what it is.

Ready to make a change?  Ready to make a difference?  We are here to help.

Within the next ten years, Light House 42 will have trained hundreds in sustainable living, permaculture, biodynamic farming practices and earth-based building.  

Those same people will have also gained practical access to cutting edge leadership practices, and acquired understanding of their own unique purpose and how to use it as a guide, in meaningful ways, as they grow.

Our aim is to put our guests on their path to Sustainable Happiness and equip them to carry that into their lives, and the lives of those connected to them.

Nowadays, Light House 42 is a tiny homestead, on two pristine hectares, with simple facilities.  

At this early stage, we offer volunteer opportunities for campers and backpackers who are as inspired as we are to push forward on the front lines one of the most important movements of our time: Learning how to live well with one another and with our Earth. 

First-time Travelers, Volunteers, Campers and Backpackers, click here to view a video designed just for you.

To find out about volunteer opportunities, message us on our Facebook fan page, or visit our website to learn more.

By mid-Autumn of 2014, Light House will be a site for Earth-based Building Intensives and a venue through which Workshops in Permaculture are offered.

Sustainability and Leadership

Sustainability

For us, sustainability means feeling satisfied about how we spend our time, money and creativity. It means sharing our individual gifts as a way of life, and as a means of sustenance, in service to causing a sustainable future for everyone.

Sustainability means wellbeing is an integral part of the experience of success. Causing that in the lives of others is our way of furthering the movement toward sustainability, on a global scale.

We've located Light House 42, outside El Bolsón, Argentina, in a region where sustainability is a way of life for the people who live there, thus giving us continuous access to resources and experience that is unparalleled.

Here is how Wikipedia defines Sustainability: 

For humans, sustainability is the potential for long-term maintenance of well being, which has ecological, economic, political and cultural dimensions. 
Sustainability requires the reconciliation of social equity with environmental    and economic demands - also referred to as the "three pillars" of sustainability or the 3 Es. 
Sustainability interfaces with economics through the social and environmental  consequences of economic activity. Sustainability economics involves ecological economics where social aspects including cultural, health-related and monetary/financial aspects are integrated. 

Light House aims to be a living, comprehensive model of Sustainability in action.

Here's an example: Our model requires building the Retreat and Learning Center through hosting Bio-Building and Permaculture Workshops. 

Literally speaking, our Retreat and Learning Center will build itself through the building workshops we host--thus keeping overhead down, providing a rich and affordable learning experience for our volunteers and participants, and furthering the Earth-based Building Movement, while getting our Retreat and Learning Center built, all at once.

This is just one example of how Sustainability is woven into the very fabric of the Light House project.

For us, Sustainability means happiness and wellbeing are an integral part of success. Causing that in the lives of an international audience is our way of furthering the movement toward sustainability, on a global scale.

Leadership

By June of 2015, once Light House is built, we will begin to promote our Twenty-One Day Intensives in Sustainable and Purpose-driven Living and Leadership, thus fulfilling our commitment to propagating and engendering Comprehensive Sustainability… and Sustainable Happiness.

Light House will be ready to receive our first formal retreat guests, starting in October of 2015. At that time we will launch the first of our Twenty-One Day Intensives.

Our Twenty-One Days training modules are structured to balance both physical and non-physical aspects of Human Being-ness by catalyzing guided, on-going inquiries and conversations, while providing an environment conducive to practical application of new skills, insights and perspectives in a sustained way. 

These modules promise to alter the ways participants engage the world and their roles in it--in empowering ways--for the rest of their lives. Participants will come away rejuvenated, inspired, directed and empowered, recognizing and valuing their own unique expressions of leadership, combined with the ability to apply it in their daily lives. 


Here's what we've got

So far, we've got our business plan, a solid standing among the locals, excellent neighbors with whom we've been collaborating for more than a year now, and the perfect piece of property, almost fully purchased.   

We've laid the ground work... 

Now, we come to You, our community, to help us with the next stage. 

We are proud and delighted to bring you this opportunity to leave your finger prints on this project from its inception. 

Light House 42 aims to bridge where we come from to expanded horizons for where we can go, not only as individuals, but as a culture. 

We want You to be a part of that.


With Your Help

With $50,000 we can make the final $15,000 payment on the Light House 42 property.

The remaining $35,000 is for the first year's operation costs and building materials, while we ramp up the business to start earning on its own, by this time next year. 

It breaks down like this:

  • $20,000 for materials and labor for the Learning Center and Great Room that includes the Community Kitchen, Library, Recording Studio, Media Lab, Offices, and Short-term Living Quarters.
  • $ 5,000 Operational Expenses for 2014
  • $ 3,000 To create a Camping Ground to host more travelers
  • $ 3,000 Solar Energy System to bring in power
  • $ 2,000 Basic Construction Materials
  • $ 1,000 Garden Fund for tools and fencing
  • $ 1,000 Transportation

If we raise more than we need:

  • $5 - 8,000 makes it possible to buy a vehicle for transporting people and materials
  • $8 - $20,000 makes it possible to continue developing infrastructure and provide additional housing
  • $20,000 + makes it possible to realize our long-term goal and open as a fully functional retreat and learning center by January 2015

If we don’t reach our goal, we will do what we can to complete the land purchase, continue to extend Light House's service for beginning travelers through our networks and at the Artisan Fair, and get the Camp Ground built.

Our Story

In late 2012, seven of us, from different parts of the US, each embarked on our own separate adventures, each knowing we were ready for a change. 

The months that followed--filled with tons of challenges, mistakes, and connections with extraordinary people--grew each of us into the inspired, purpose-driven people we are today.

                                 

Our rapport and shared paths gave us the confidence to join forces and take the leap into the lives we'd only dreamed of months before.

We realized we had everything we needed to make it happen, especially the commitment to this mission. 

Click on this link for more of Our Story.

                         Act Now!

Notice how helping Light House 42 to the next level helps YOU Be the Change you want to see in the world.

             It feels good to be a part!

To track our progress and learn more about our project, follow us on Facebook at our Light House 42 fan page and check out our website: www.lighthouse42.net

    Can't donate today? You can still help.

                 Make some noise for our campaign! 

  • Tell your friend who just graduated college and is ready to do some soul searching
  • Post it on your Facebook wall
  • Email our campaign link to your aunt living on an organic farm 
  • Tell your cousin who teaches at the high school or community college
  • Make or let us send you a flyer to post at your community garden 
  • Share it with your writer's group
  • Send our link to your professor friend who teaches permaculture at the UC or CSU or your friend who attends Naropa
  • Bring it up in conversations with the folks you always see at your local natural food store

Use Indiegogo's share tools!

story:
We're Going to Israel, We Hope!

Hello, my name is Williamson Deavours (right). I am from Tennessee and a junior in Bible College. Kody (Creed) Mullins (left) is my classmate and is from Kentucky. We are both very passionate about our callings. We have a desire to understand the Bible and its context to the best of our abilities. The door has opened where one of our professors is leading an oversea study of Corinth, Athens, and many parts of Israel. This would be a 14-day study of a portion of the Biblical world. We feel this is a prime opportunity to broaden our understanding and grow spiritually. It is more than just a study to us; it is walking the same streets as our Savior and His disciples. We want a more in-depth grasp of the Bible -- not only for our own sake -- but for sharing the good news and effectively discipling others. We understand the amount for this trip is steep, but we feel, as God has opened this door for us, He will make a way. So, we are setting a goal to reach out to 12,500 people. This is how you can get involved! PRAY, GIVE, and SHARE our project on all your favorite social networks! 


  • What We Need
  • We need twelve thousand five hundred dollars and with this we will be able to go from Corinth, to Athens, and then to study throughout Israel with our professor.
  • We need you to share our project on your Facebook and Twitter!
  • To show our appreciation for your support, we have come up with a few options for us to be able to give back and share our experience with our supporters.
The Impact

Not only will this greatly change our lives by growing our understanding of the Bible's context. Also, it will greatly effect our preaching and teaching ministries and enable us to share a more detailed and vivid message from the Bible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

First, we desire your prayers not only for this trip but for God's will in our lives. Then, share our project on your Facebook and Twitter pages! Remember any amount you can give we greatly appreciate!

story:
Short Summary

Brandon P. Mauney was a wonderful friend, son, brother, uncle, and all-around great human being. In addition to his trademark sense of humor and infectious smile, Brandon was caring, giving, and loved to give back to his community.

Brandon was a proud graduate of Carver High School and Winston-Salem State University. His love for Carver High, and the academic success of all its students, has lead to the creation of the B. Mauney Heart Scholarship. This charitable effort will honor Brandon’s commitment to education and helping others. The scholarship is available to male students who are eligible for graduation from Carver High School in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.

On February 16, 2014, Brandon P. Mauney passed away due to heart disease with contributing factors such as hypertensive heart disease. Heart disease is the leading cause of death for people of most ethnicities in the United States, including African Americans, Hispanics, and whites. For American Indians or Alaska Natives and Asians or Pacific Islanders, heart disease is second only to cancer. Below are the percentages of all deaths caused by heart disease in 2008, listed by ethnicity.

Race of Ethnic Group % of Deaths African Americans 24.5 American Indians or Alaska Natives 18.0 Asians or Pacific Islanders 23.2 Hispanics 20.8 Whites 25.1 All 25.0

I encourage you to keep Brandon’s legacy alive by donating to the B. Mauney Heart Scholarship fund. If you have any questions please contact me for more details at 336-686-0680 or menoaction@gmail.com. Thanks in advance for your generosity!

Sincerely,

LaShun Huntley

story:
Short Summary

DOOWISE C.I.C. is currently running a project in Poland. We are working on delivering the very first transformational course in the country called Listening to Life: Living Beyond the Story in Krakow in October of 2014. It is a Pan European course.

We have set up a scholarship fund to enable those who are ready and willing to participate in the programme but, due to severe financial difficulties, would be unable to do so without support from us.

We need to raise £500 to have up to three scholarships available for the upcoming course. The maximum scholarship we will offer will be 50% of the course fee, which is no more than 200€ or £160 per scholarship. Candidates for the scholarships will be carefully and fairly evaluated.

    The Impact

    Transformational work is the education of the future. It has an amazing potential for personal as well as societal development. This course will mark a new chapter for personal development education market in Poland and Central Europe.

    To read more about this particular course please check out the links below:

    Introductory event:

    https://www.facebook.com/events/1470616443223068/

    An article by David on human technology being a weak link in our civilisation's evolution is included on this event's page.

    Course info:

    http://www.doowise.org/Site/courses.html

    About David:

    http://www.navigatingfromthefuture.com/programs/Allies

    http://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/David_Norris

    One correction: David's experience is something more like over 40 years in the field of transformational work (these articles above have been written some time ago).

    FB:

    https://www.facebook.com/ListeningToLifeCourse?ref=hl

    Twitter:

    https://twitter.com/doowisecic

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Help us spread the word by telling your friends and colleagues.

story:
Hi!!

I'm going to keep it short and sweet so I don't bore you guys:')

My name is Jordan and I am 16 years old. I live in England and I am currently studying my AS Levels. My Campaign is basically to raise money for me to be able to go on a school trip to South Africa to visit our partner school and teach them vital life skills. I find this opportunity important to me as it will be a life changing experience. Visiting our partner school and teaching them basic lessons such as English, Music, Science and Art would allow me to experience teaching different cultures. By donating, you would help me to achieve my goal, and I would be able to visit South Africa and experience different cultures and backgrounds.

How much funding do I need?

For my funding, ideally I would need £3,900 to cover the costs of the trip. The whole of the funding would help me cover;

  • Tickets and expenses (food, accommodation, insurance etc.)
  • Money for needed injections/vaccines
  • Money to help purchase equipment for the school in South Africa

    If I don't reach my target, the money raised would go towards the flights and expenses (depending on how much I raise).

    Don't worry, I'm doing my own fundraising as well - I'm not leaving it all down to you guys:')

Importance

My project is valuable to the world as I would be providing life skills to the less privileged. It would also help make the community more productive, as we would be teaching new skills to people in a less privileged part of the world. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Risks I will come across will be difficulties raising money. As I am only 16, I haven't got access to money easily. My parents will help where possible but with bills, I need to look elsewhere to make this experience possible.

      I hope you guys can help, it would be much appreciated!!

  Importance
 My project is valuable to the world as I would be providing life skills to the less privileged. It would also help make the community more productive, as we would be teaching new skills to people in a less privileged part of the world. 

  Risks & Challenges Risks I will come across will be difficulties raising money. As I am only 16, I haven't got access to money easily. My parents will help where possible but with bills, I need to look elsewhere to make this experience possible.

  I hope you guys can help, it would be much appreciated!!

story:
Foundation Futuro Lleno de Esperanza

The Foundation FLE is a faith based NGO located in the Cibao Region of the Dominican Republic offering services to marginalized communities of both Dominicans and Haitians. 


The Colegio Futuro Lleno de Esperanza is the foundation's largest pre-school and elementary program, serving nearly 100 students from 3 years to 4th grade. This year is our fourth year offering a high quality, hands-on educational program to a community in need.

The Cienfuegos area of Santiago is one of the most impoverished in the DR - financially and educationally. The population has grown so quickly that educational services have not been able to keep up, leaving a vast number of school aged children out of classrooms simply for lack of space in public institutions, and lack of possibility to pay for private school.


The average family income of our students, for a family of five, is $216 USD. The majority of our parents have not graduated from high school, many have not passed eighth grade. However, despite these hardships, our families are committed to their children's futures and are investing in their futures by enrolling them in school. 

By offering a program with small classroom sizes and qualified teachers, paired with a nutritional breakfast program, Colegio FLE is able to offer a "future filled with hope" to its students. 


How can you help?

The Colegio has a shared-responsibility agreement with the families we serve. For  $6 USD a month, families are investing in trained teachers, quality supplies and materials and a daily,nutritional breakfast. The Foundation raises funds to complete the costs of the school - about $15 USD per student in addition to the family investment.

We are  about $900 USD under-budget for the rest of this calendar year! 


By donating - even just ONE dollar - we can continue to offer an outstanding education to our students with special gym classes, field trips and more. As a supporter, you will receive updates from the school. Check out the "perks" you'll get for contributing on the side bar.

If we don't reach $900, the money will still be applied to the budget AND if we go over our $900, we will be able to offer even more to our students this school year!

story:
About Me and Happiness.Working.


I'm Sam. I'm 31 years old and I live in Brighton. For my full time job, I help develop budding entrepreneurs at the University of Brighton. In my spare time, I'm training to be a psychotherapist. I can safely say I love what I do, and it makes me happy. But, it's taken me a lot of hard work and a long time to get to this point. 

When I graduated from university, I noticed that I, and nearly all of my friends had no idea what work they wanted to do, like they felt lost, and, when we were given careers guidance, no one ever asked us, 


" What makes you happy?"


Tal Ben-Shahar Phd., who teaches the most popular course at Harvard, describes happiness as the "ultimate currency", and I couldn't agree more. Of course, we need to put food on the table and pay our bills, but, I think it's essential that we're happy when we're at work. 

So, using my education and experience, and in conjunction with a fully qualified and experienced psychotherapist and business coach, I've put together a training course that teaches you how to choose work that makes you happy. One-to-one, 1 session per week, 1 short piece of homework per week, for 5 weeks. 

With your pledges, I'll get my website designed and built, meaning I'll have something to refer potential customers to. In addition, I'll pay a graphic designer to make the learning materials I've produced look professional. And sexy. Finally, the aforementioned designer will produce me a postcard sized flyer, and I'll have a batch of 500 printed, which I'll hand out in targeted areas of Brighton and Hove, and advertise in chosen shop windows. This will enable me to advertise, direct people to the website, and generate enquiries.

For every 4 places I sell on the course, I will give one place for free to someone leaving higher education in Brighton. From my experience, it is they who could use it most, as they begin their venture in to the 'real world' of work, however they are laden with thousands of pounds worth of debt. 


How I'll Spend the Money


To have the website designed and built, I've secured a spectacularly amazing deal of £550.

The fee for the designer to add sex appeal to my learning materials, and to produce a postcard sized flyer will be £400. 

Printing 500 flyers at a local printer, including delivery, will cost £50. 

The remaining £ is to cover the fee for running this campaign.

I've already invested £600 of my own money and time to get this project to where it is. In an ideal world, as I'm quite proud, I would fund the whole thing myself, however, I was unemployed for a few months, and any surplus money I have from my salary is paying off the debt I accrued (around £4000). Not including student loan - that's a whole other story...

(The following image has nothing to do with how I'll spend the money - rather, this is the location where the contents of the course were hammered out with me' pal.)


The Perks


Roll up, roll up. From £3 to £250, there's something for everyone!


£3 - you want to chuck a few quid my way. You like the sound of the course, and would like to give me a wee leg up. You're a star. 


£5 - I'll fetch your number from you when the campaign has ended, and call you to say thank you. We can chat about what happiness means to us, and why we think it's important. And maybe talk about food. I love food. 


£10 - I'll add you to my email list, meaning you'll be privy to the most recent updates of my campaign, and, when I've launched the service, you'll have exclusive access to latest news and special offers. 


£10 - Supposedly we're more connected to each other than ever these days, but there's something special about receiving a hand written letter through the post. And that's what you'll get from me, to say thanks for your investment. My handwriting is appalling, but you'll be able to feel the love emanating from the paper. 


£25 - Just like in the movies, your name will appear in the credits. Well, in this instance, it will be in the opening pages of the learning material for the course. Your investment helps me a lot, so your contribution will be recognised, forever more! When the training material is finalised, I'll send you a photo so you can see for yourself!


£50 - Now we're getting serious. At the end of the campaign, and once the designer has made it look sexy, you'll receive an electronic copy (.pdf) of the learning material. Complete with instructions, diagrams and exercises, you'll be able to teach yourself how to choose work that makes you happy. Bingo.  


£250 - The Full Monty. The Big Daddy. One-to-one, in a relaxed yet motivating  atmosphere, I'll personally deliver the course to you. 1 session per week, 1 piece of homework per week, for 5 weeks. We'll cover emotional intelligence, the importance of early life experiences & the construction of your belief system, how to decide what's your dream work scenario, and then how to plan to get it. All via an invigorating blend of psychology, psychotherapy and business coaching. By the end of the 5 weeks, you'll have the tools to know how to choose work that makes you happy, and to enable you to get it. 


£250 - As above, except I'll deliver the course to a recent graduate of either Brighton or Sussex University. 


£400 - The Full Monty for yourself, and a recent graduate of either Brighton or Sussex University. 


Why I'm Doing This


Like Tal Ben-Shahar, I'm driven by the ultimate currency, i.e. happiness. We spend 35% of our waking week at work, so I think it's essential that we're happy there. Karl Marx said it a couple of hundred of years ago, as did Abraham Maslow, and as are a raft of positive psychologists these days.

Like ripples on the surface of a pond, happiness spreads. When we're happy, we'll make our friends and loved ones happy. And that will spread further. Society will become more happy. The emotional and physical benefits of happiness (and, by default, being less stressed) are well documented. 

More happy and healthy people also equals reduced strain on our health system. 


(Brighton beach on a sunny day - absolutely love it)


Why Me?


I regularly mentor budding entrepreneurs in my day job, so have the experience and skills to enable me to effectively pass the knowledge and techniques on to my clients. I have a degree in economics and management from Leeds University Business School, meaning I have a good business head on my shoulders. 

Training as a psychotherapist, and having worked with young people with severe leaning disabilities and challenging behaviour for 2 years, means I have developed particular patience, empathy and a kind manner. 

Essentially, what I'm saying is, my future clients will be in good hands and I'm well equipped to give them a fulfilling learning experience.  


The Social Element


From my experience, of both being a graduate of, and working in a university, the majority of people who leave higher education don't know what work they want to do. Furthermore, they aren't capable of determining what work makes them feel happy. At the same time, they're laden with thousands and thousands of pounds worth of debt (£44,000 on average, according to the latest government report). So, for each four places that I sell on the training course, I will give one place for free to someone leaving higher education in Brighton. 



If You're Broke - You Can Still Help!


I know what it's like to be skint - I was a student for 4 years. So, if you can't invest any money, I totally understand! You can still do a lot to help. Using the Indiegogo share tools here, you can shout out about my campaign and help spread the word. Like happiness, news spreads!


Help me help our society become more happy!


Sam x

story:
Attending NIAC Leadership Conference

I am Hesam Sarvghad-Moghaddam, the president of Persian Association at NDSU (PANDSU) at North Dakota State University. Developing leadership and interpersonal skills is one of the main goals of PANDSU and the related officers are always trying to come up with innovative and creative ideas to promote these skills among the members of the association.

PANDSU has provided so many interactive events and social gatherings throughout the past eight years and has focused on providing the best opportunities for the Iranians of North Dakota. Moreover, PANDSU member have been involved in several volunteering opportunities to better serve the community they are living in. This year, several members of this organization have taken the challenge to serve at the concession stand at Fargodome facility which the main facility in Fargo where many of the most important events in North Dakota occurs at that. These group of 17 people have devoted themselves to attend several events to promote fundraising for the association.

To this end, PANDSU has chosen the NIAC leadership conference as the unique opportunity for this organization to enhance their skills by interacting with world class leaders and decision makers. PANDSU not only strives to serve its members and the community to its fullest potential, but also it is putting a great effort into addressing the Iranian community inside and outside of the United States. PANDSU believes that it is essential for all the communities and organizations in the US to learn about the policies and the politics affecting them and their families. PANDSU believes that Iranian American groups should come together, exchange ideas and develop unique leaders to strengthen the Iranian Americans. Upon raising enough funding, the President, Vice President, Event Coordinator and three active members of the PANDSU (total of 6 members) would like to attend the NIAC leadership conference, to achieve the mentioned goals and provide the highlights of the conference to all the members.

A partial breakdown of the estimate of the travel and attendance expenditures for six members (3 officers and 3 active members) are provided in the table below:

Item

Estimated expenses to attend the conference.

Airfare

$ 1000

Lodging

$ 852

Food and Transportation

$ 200

Total

$2052


As the president of PANDSU, I would like to request for your kind consideration for a partial funding support ($2052) for the 3 officers and 3 active members (total of 6 members) of the PANDSU to attend this great conference so they can serve better to the Iranian American community in the United States.

Note: The amount provided in the table ($ 2052) is for six attendants while the amount mentioned on the page ($1511) will pay only for 3 people to go. The Indiegogo doesn't allow changing it! I am sorry for the inconvenience!

About Us

The Persian Association at NDSU (PANDSU) is a non-profit organization in North Dakota State University. The organization thrives on serving the Iranian community within the state of North Dakota to facilitate the living situations for different Iranian communities. Student and faculties comprise the main population of the PANDSU members and hence, the association is mainly involved with addressing the students’ problems and challenges. The main objectives of PANDSU can be summarized as:

· Bring together the Iranian people and their families of all heritage and interested people from other countries to appreciate Persian culture, history, literature, and art through a series of cultural ceremonies and recreational activities

· Participate in the enhancement of the University's diversity and existing multicultural framework

· Provide a sense of community and a support network for Iranians and interested people

· Promote friendship and goodwill between Iranians and interested people

· Provide help to new Iranian students so they are better prepared for the transition

story:
Short Summary

Student involvement in the creation of intellectual property (IP) with real economic and social value is increasing.  Institutions often assert blanket ownership over student innovation when only the slightest bit of institutional resources are involved. Students also frequently report confusion and mistrust surrounding IP laws and their university’s respective position on student IP. These unfair and often ambiguous campus IP policies threaten to stymie the culture of student innovation and entrepreneurship sweeping the nation and already taking hold at leading institutions around the country.

What We Need & What You Get

With your help we can send students to promote the legislation nationwide.  Our goal is to reach to the most influential policy makers.  Your contributions and support will be rewarded with a variety of perks!

SIGN THE PETITION

    The Impact

    With students risking their futures every day by incurring thousands of dollars in student loan debt, we believe the duty of institutions to maximize the value of a U.S. college education is as paramount as ever.  Our team is a nationwide group of students and business owners with front-line experience dealing with student IP rights and regulations.

      Risks & Challenges

      The collaborative network we have has already reached political affiliates in Washington DC.  We hope to solidify connections and assure a change in legislature.  This will be a delicate process.  Your support will show the nation that a shock wave of innovation is upon us.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Your help is greatly appreciated, please share this cause!

story:
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE'RE RESTORING

Perched atop North Mountain near the rustic town of Darrington, Washington is the North Mountain Fire Lookout, a once prominent tower in the North Cascades.  Presently it is a ghost of it's former eminence and is in need of some tender-loving care.  A plan has been implemented by a group of enthusiastic folks who want to restore the lookout to it's former golden heyday.

Friends of North Mountain is a grass roots organization that is building community and preserving history through the restoration of the North Mountain Lookout.  It is our vision that restoring the lookout will foster pride among townspeople here in Darrington, impacted by the tragic mudslide near Oso in 2014.  Upon completion, the North Mountain Lookout will be available for nightly rental, bringing visitors to this rural town and providing local residents with an opportunity to share their unique history and culture.

Our goal is to have the North Mountain Lookout restoration completed and ready to rent by Spring 2017.  With over 2,000 volunteer-hours to date, we have made the tower structurally sound and have installed a new cabin roof.  Your generous contribution will help us propel the project forward to completion.


WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR

  • Lightning arrestor system
  • Building Materials (windows, doors, cabinetry, deck and railing, etc)
  • Security (gates, locks, cameras, etc)
  • Cabin furnishings and appliances
  • Osborne fire finder
  • Utility lines
  • Insurance
  • Road Maintenance
  • Structural and grounds maintenance
  • Operating expenses
  • Marketing
  • Transportation
  • Volunteer meals
  • Trail maintenance and development


WHAT HAPPENS WHEN THE PROJECT IS FINISHED

Once the restoration is completed, the Friends of North Mountain will implement a rental system that, after the initial investment, will cover it's maintenance and operating expenses for years to come.  Guests will have the use of propane for heat and cooking as well as panoramic windows and a wraparound catwalk to take in the world-class scenery.  

Please help our community restore this rare piece of history by donating to our campaign and sharing the link with others who may share our vision.  

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!


MORE INFORMATION ON THE LOOKOUT

The North Mountain Lookout was constructed by Wood Fab. Co. & V.L. between August 24, 1964 and November 15, 1965 and is a Region Six (R6) flat cab with a 41' treated timber tower.  The R6 flat cab is a live-in lookout structure introduced by the United States Forest Service (USFS) Region Six in 1953.  Individual examples of this cab type feature a flat roof with overhanging eaves and window styles ranging from two-light, wood sash to the four-light design of the North Mountain cab. 

Less than 100 of the original 656 lookouts in Washington State are left standing.  Nationwide, nearly one lookout per week is lost to neglect or disrepair.

North Mountain Lookout is eligible for the National Register of Historic Places for it's contribution to the history of fire management in the USFS as one of only three remaining R6 Flat Cabs and as one of only thirteen remaining lookouts in the Mt. Baker-Snoqualmie National Forest.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Share this link with your friends
  • Visit our website northmountainlookout.com
  • Volunteer for a work party
story_txt:
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE'RE RESTORINGPerched atop North Mountain near the rustic town of Darrington, Washington is the North Mountain Fire Lookout, a once prominent tower in the North Cascades.  Presently it is a ghost of it's former eminence and is in need of some tender-loving care.  A plan has been implemented by a group of enthusiastic folks who want to restore the lookout to it's former golden heyday.Friends of North Mountain is a grass roots organization that is building community and preserving history through the restoration of the North Mountain Lookout.  It is our vision that restoring the lookout will foster pride among townspeople here in Darrington, impacted by the tragic mudslide near Oso in 2014.  Upon completion, the North Mountain Lookout will be available for nightly rental, bringing visitors to this rural town and providing local residents with an opportunity to share their unique history and culture.Our goal is to have the North Mountain Lookout restoration completed and ready to rent by Spring 2017.  With over 2,000 volunteer-hours to date, we have made the tower structurally sound and have installed a new cabin roof.  Your generous contribution will help us propel the project forward to completion.WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR
Lightning arrestor system
Building Materials (windows, doors, cabinetry, deck and railing, etc)
Security (gates, locks, cameras, etc)

Cabin furnishings and appliances

Osborne fire finder
Utility lines

Insurance
Road Maintenance
Structural and grounds maintenance
Operating expenses
Marketing

Transportation
Volunteer meals
Trail maintenance and development
WHAT HAPPENS WHEN THE PROJECT IS FINISHEDOnce the restoration is completed, the Friends of North Mountain will implement a rental system that, after the initial investment, will cover it's maintenance and operating expenses for years to come.  Guests will have the use of propane for heat and cooking as well as panoramic windows and a wraparound catwalk to take in the world-class scenery.  Please help our community restore this rare piece of history by 
donating to our campaign and sharing the link with others who may share our vision.   THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!MORE INFORMATION ON THE LOOKOUTThe North Mountain Lookout was constructed by Wood Fab. Co. & V.L. between August 24, 1964 and November 15, 1965 and is a Region Six (R6) flat cab with a 41' treated timber tower.  The R6 flat cab is a live-in lookout structure introduced by the United States Forest Service (USFS) Region Six in 1953.  Individual examples of this cab type feature a flat roof with overhanging eaves and window styles ranging from two-light, wood sash to the four-light design of the North Mountain cab.  Less than 100 of the original 656 lookouts in Washington State are left standing.  Nationwide, nearly one lookout per week is lost to neglect or disrepair.North Mountain Lookout is eligible for the National Register of Historic Places for it's contribution to the history of fire management in the USFS as one of only three remaining R6 Flat Cabs and as one of only thirteen remaining lookouts in the Mt. Baker-Snoqualmie National Forest.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Share this link with your friends

Visit our website northmountainlookout.com
Volunteer for a work party

story:
I, Keyah Levy am writing on behalf of the Gates Park Youth Basketball League. The objectives of this organization is to enroll, excite and empower our youth.  We are devoted to stopping the violence and revitalizing the environment in order to improve and encourage unity within our community. In recent years there has been an increase in high school dropout rates, crime, and death by way of violence. We are committed to reversing this devastating statistics.

Our children are our most valuable resources and the GPYBL is committed to making a positive difference in the lives of our youth.

Every summer we put on a community event over the course of a few weeks (June & July). This year will include (but is not limited to) a community ball, book club, BBQ/picnic & swim party, a basketball tournament and possibly football and softball tournaments. 

We are currently asking for donations and/or sponsorship (monetary or goods/services) with our efforts.

The Gates Park Youth Basketball League is a 501 © 3 non-profit organization who strives to provide structured activities for the youth of Waterloo. Previous years our administrative operating budget cost was around $50,000 and operational cost for the league was about $30,000. This year we have a number of enthused volunteers and have estimated operational cost to run the program will be about $20,000. We are asking participants(basketball players) to contribute by paying a $20 registration fee. We are asking you for a generous contribution, of 1,000 (or whatever you can contribute) all donations will go towards the implementation of the program which includes but is not limited to: Uniforms, Academic and athletic staff, promotional items, equipment (i.e. basketballs) refreshments, 1st Aid Kits and the Alumni game and ceremony.

Thank you in advance for your consideration. Your financial support is vital in uplifting our community and is greatly appreciated. Please make checks payable to: The Gates Park Youth Basketball League send to P.O. Box 1134 Waterloo, IA 50704 or call/visit Veridian Credit Union and make a donation to the “Gates Park Youth Basketball League at (319) 236-5600. Your donation is tax deductible.

story:
My name is David Kruglinski and I am a sixth grade science teacher. Before becoming a teacher, I was a computer programmer.  Because I saw many unmet opportunities to teach children with computers, I started writing educational programs for my students.  After many years of writing and rewriting, my software is now ready to be a product, and I seek the funds to leave my job as a teacher and start an educational software company.


The software I have created has evolved as the result of hundreds of experiments.   It was also my Master's in Education project.   Initially, it was surprising to observe how effective my software was with many children with learning disabilities, and I have learned the rigid structure that software can provide can unlock hidden talents in students. I am always happy to see my software reveal to teachers, parents, and even the students themselves, that they can learn very effectively, and sometimes even better than their peers, with the right methods.  My software reveals and teaches those methods, and has the students repeat them until mastery is achieved,

I want to turn my incomplete software into a large, polished, complete math and science package for middle schools and high schools.  For example, my software teaches astronomy and geology, but I want to add meteorology.  My software teaches 6th and 8th grade science standards, but I want to cover every 7th grade science standard too.  My software teaches fraction-to-decimal conversion, but I can add lessons on algebra and computer programming with the funding I seek.

But mostly, I want it to change special education by displaying the effectiveness of certain key accommodations and methods for learning. When teachers and students see that these methods work, they will be motivated to adopt these methods on a regular basis.  And when that happens, education will be a better place for all.

I wish to call my company, Jay Robot Education.

It can be difficult to persuade schools to try something new.  If you, as a contributor, would purchase this for a school facing challenges, it would motivate them to try it and then see that it works.  Together, let's inspire schools to give special education a new approach sparked by a better technology.

It is my hope that 300 schools will be given this software through generous donations, and that this will start a word-of-mouth campaign about the methods of this software.

How Will the Funds Be Spent?

If I can reach my funding goal, I will leave my job as a teacher and work on this full-time, hire three employees, purchase software development tools, rent an office, and have a finished product in five months.  With less funding, it will take longer, but my goal is to have a product ready for schools for school year 2015-2016 (next summer).  The software will be sent to the school of your choice when it is complete, with a year license beginning at that time.  A letter announcing your generous donation and commitment to special education will be sent to the principal of that school.


How Do Donors Know the Software Will Be Completed?

A version is already completed and is installed at an Atlanta school.  It is called MindMatch 44 and it teaches middle school math and science with special education accommodations.  With the new funds I seek, I wish to re-write the software in a more powerful programming language, add over 100 new lessons, update the look-and-feel with better artwork, and add new teaching methods and new special educational accommodations.

I have seven years experience as a software developer, including three years at IBM and eight years' experience working in special education.  Our Project Manager, Patrica Green,  is an expert at leading software products and assuring they are user-friendly, reliable, high-quality, and get completed on-budget and on-time.  Our Director of Art and Animation, Edison Goncalves, is a highly-experienced artist who has created art for animated movies and educational TV shows like Curious George. Our director of special education, Winifred Pierce, has 31 years' experience as a teacher and administrator, including leadership in special education, and will ensure our software is optimally designed to teach children who struggle with a variety of challenges.

Our dedicated team is committed to creating excellent and effective educational software, staying true to our mission, and having a positive and revolutionary effect on the field of special education.

story:
Summary

  • Team ROBUS are a team of five students from Livingston, central Scotland. We are all aged between 15 and 16 years old.
  • We are committed to raising the funds required to compete effectively at the World Finals 2014 - to be held in Ferrari World Abu Dhabi this November.
  • We have been participating in the F1 in Schools challenge, which aims to develop skills and qualities, particularly focused around the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths) areas.  
What We Need To Raise
  • In order to compete, we need to raise £20,000.
  • This money goes towards all aspects of the challenge, including: travel, accommodation, materials and uniforms. 
  • Funds which we raise will also go to the 'Bloodhound' project which we are running, involving our team working with the local primary schools in our area.
Our Work
  • We would very much appreciate if you would help us reach our goal.
  • If you are interested in sponsoring us outside of this fundraiser, please visit our website (robus-f1.com) and get in touch.
  • We have been working to raise funds and have built up many successful business links, including a range of local companies and globally recognised brands.
  • We will be launching our 'Bloodhound' project in Septmber, which will involve our team leading a project with our five local primary schools, and involving over 200 Primary 7 (10/11 year old) students.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please visit our website and spread the word of our team to everyone you know.
    • You can also follow us on Facebook (/ROBUSF1) and Twitter (@robusf1)
story_txt:
Summary 
Team ROBUS are a team of five students from Livingston, central Scotland. We are all aged between 15 and 16 years old. We are committed to raising the funds required to compete effectively at the World Finals 2014 - to be held in Ferrari World Abu Dhabi this November.
We have been participating in the F1 in Schools challenge, which aims to develop skills and qualities, particularly focused around the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths) areas.  

  What We Need To Raise
In order to compete, we need to raise £20,000. This money goes towards all aspects of the challenge, including: travel, accommodation, materials and uniforms. 
Funds which we raise will also go to the 'Bloodhound' project which we are running, involving our team working with the local primary schools in our area.


Our Work

We would very much appreciate if you would help us reach our goal.

If you are interested in sponsoring us outside of this fundraiser, please visit our website (robus-f1.com) and get in touch.
We have been working to raise funds and have built up many successful business links, including a range of local companies and globally recognised brands.
We will be launching our 'Bloodhound' project in Septmber, which will involve our team leading a project with our five local primary schools, and involving over 200 Primary 7 (10/11 year old) students.

  Other Ways You Can Help 
Please visit our website and spread the word of our team to everyone you know.
You can also follow us on Facebook (/ROBUSF1) and Twitter (@robusf1)

story:
Learn & Earn app

Motivate. Encourage. Repeat. 

The Learn & Earn app for iPad is an exciting new way to motivate kids to meet and exceed learning goals. Launching for elementary school math (Grades 1-4) across the US, the app allows parents to define a motivational scheme that connects learning goals to real rewards from Amazon's store.  

For example, parents may set up a scheme that says "If my child does 10 minutes of math for 10 days, I'm willing to spend $10 in rewards." Kids then start off by choosing one of hundreds of select rewards to work towards (and parents can add their child's favorites to this list). All rewards are clearly tagged with an exact number of days of math practice it would take to earn them. 

500,000+ strong questionnaire designed by educators 

The app has built-in math quizzes designed by curriculum experts - with hundreds of skills across Grades 1 to 4, and over 500,000 questions covering the US Standard Core curriculum. The Learn & Earn app has been especially designed to adapt to each child's learning curve, so that every child can improve steadily and at a pace with which they are comfortable.  

Parenting magic made seamless

During their daily quiz, kids are cheered on by our unflappable and adorable mascot, 'Drago', who will remind each child to stick to their daily 10 minutes of math. With his many tricks and gentle reminders, Drago helps kids count down the days to their reward. Once kids meet their goals, the app initiates purchase of the reward via Amazon.com - so that their well-earned reward arrives right at your doorstep.

Help us get it ready in time for the school term! 

Developed by an international team of software developers and educators, we are working to launch this patent-pending app in time for the new school term. Your contributions will help us complete development and testing through summer, so the kids have this app when its time to get back to school! 

Designed for Busy, Discerning Parents: 

Set it up once & you're done

Every parent knows (and scientists have confirmed) that children get naturally better at math or reading if they’re willing to practice on an everyday basis. 

Parents recognize that iPads and other tablets can be a great educational medium, with hundreds of apps ready to offer kids their daily dose of reading, math or science.  In reality though, parents realize that most iPads end up becoming yet another "screen" for easy entertainment.

So as busy parents that want the very best for our kids, we wonder: What might it take to get kids to do 10 or 15 minutes of math or reading? Every single day? Without constant reminding?

Step #1: Set up your personalized motivational scheme. 

It takes only seconds to set up your scheme. Our suggested schemes incorporate ideas that focus on 'Good Habits' - smaller practice times over more days; 'Better @ Math' - healthy practice times to improve your child's math; and 'Best Performers' - for kids that are ready for healthy practice times over an extended number of days. 

Each parent picks what they know works best for their child.

Step #2: Select skills your child needs to work on. 

Each Grade has anywhere between 100 and 150 types of questions, all designed to meet or exceed the US Standard Core curriculum, organized into 20 to 30 Skills. Each Skill is associated with easy to identify icons designed for easy recall. 

You can either work with your child to incorporate specific skills upfront as part of their reward - or let your kids pick skills to practice on any given day.   


Step #3: Screen among 100s of rewards. 

We've handpicked 100s of rewards for every age, for boys and for girls, so you don't have to spend the time doing it. Parents can screen rewards they wish to exclude from their child's selection. Or add custom ones from Amazon's store based on your child's wishes.  

Step #4. You're done! (How long did that take?)

You can sit back and wait to hear from us once your child earns each reward -  as the parent, you get to approve each purchase using your Amazon account. 
You can revisit the app dashboard to check on how your kids are doing. You can check our weekly reports to see how your child did in any given week. You can review your scheme anytime to adjust practice times, reward amounts, or skills to practice.


Designed for Elementary School Kids: 

Choose reward. Practice. Learn. Earn reward. Repeat.

When kids check in to the app, they first get to choose the reward they want to earn. By picking their choice of reward, kids motivate themselves to meet their learning goals. No more reminding by parents. Kids can choose to practice any time of the day. Every practice session brings them a day closer to the reward of their choice.  

Step #1: Pick a reward.

Rewards are tagged with the exact number of days it takes to earn them. Kids pick one reward of their choice to work towards.

Step #2: Pick a skill to practice.

Kids can practice one or more skills on any given day, as long as they stick to their overall practice times. 

Step #3: Practice. Learn. Rapidly improve math.

Each practice session is tuned to each child's learning curve. Drago, our dear mascot, keeps track of time, so kids have a clear sense of progress and time spent.  

Step #4: Earn your Reward. Then repeat.

Drago will let your child know as soon as they're done with their daily goal. Each day ends with a clear reminder of how close kids are to their reward. 


Are we there yet?

We are already running early-prototype tests among the first batch of parents & kids! We're working on completing development and testing, so we can get the app ready by the end of summer, and in time for start of the new school term! 


So your contributions will help us meet this timeline with ensuring that the app is ready when kids are ready to get back to school and math!

The Learn & Earn Team:

Our team combines the efforts of computer scientists, software entrepreneurs and designers - plus the curricular expertise of our content partners, the Gardner School of Arts & Sciences in Vancouver, WA, that helped develop our math questionnaire.   

Funding and Perks

Perk #1: 1 year app subscription @ $18

The first 500 subscribers ("Earliest birds") will receive 75% off regular subscription of the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math. (Regular annual subscription price is $72). 

Perk #2: 1 year app subscription @ $29

Another 500 subscribers ("Early birds") will receive ~60% off regular subscription of the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math. (Regular annual subscription price of $72). 

Perk #3: Drago's Rewards Calendar + 1 year app subscription @ $49

This magnetic calendar provides the perfect supplement for your Learn & Earn app subscription. Designed by our in-house team, this beautiful calendar is designed for the family fridge, where your kids can keep the whole family involved and updated about their upcoming Learning goals and rewards! 
The calendar comes with a gallery of magnetic icons - representing rewards, goals and other fun signs and reminders that are best served by your child's imagination!

Along with this, you will also receive a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math.

Perk #4: Drago's iPad sleeve + Drago's Rewards Calendar + 1 year app subscription @$69

This iPad sleeve, designed by our in-house team, provides protection for your iPad and features our app mascot, Drago, right on the cover! We provide this sleeve in two sizes - one for regular sized iPads and one for iPad minis, so please let us know what sizes you're looking for (default size: regular iPad). 

Along with this, you will also receive the Rewards Calendar (see Perk #3) and of course, a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math.  

Perk #5: Handcrafted premium leather iPad sleeve + Drago's Calendar + 1 year app subscription @$89

This premium iPad sleeve, has been specially designed by our in-house team and handcrafted from genuine leather. Using aniline dye and the high-grade cowhide, the sleeve retains the natural grain of the leather. 

Besides providing protection for your iPad, this is a stylish accessory that will blend equally well on the home-couch or in a business meeting. A logo subtly embossed on the flap will be our reminder of your timely contributions to this app's launch!  

Along with this sleeve, you will also receive the Rewards Calendar (see Perk #3) and of course, a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math. 

 

Perk #6: Your caricature goes into the app + Premium leather iPad sleeve + Drago's Rewards Calendar + 1 year app subscription @$199

We've put a lot of effort into the friendly illustrations and design styling that has gone into the app. So what better way to be associated with the app than to have a cartoon/ caricature made of you (along with your name) and to make it part of the app during its launch? We're calling this "Drago's Hall of Famous Funders". Only a 100 contributors will be inducted!

Along with this, you will also receive the premium leather iPad sleeve (see Perk #5), the Rewards Calendar (see Perk #3) and of course, a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math.    

Parenting Food for Thought

#1: Kids + iPads = All play + No work?

When the first iPad was introduced, kids finally had access to a computer like they never did before: a device that even pre-schoolers could use comfortably. 

Parents recognize that tablets present a great educational medium, with hundreds of apps ready to provide kids with a daily-dose of reading, math or science.  In reality though, parents realize that most iPads end up being something else: Yet another "screen" for easy entertainment, rather than than the educational tool they hoped it would be.

Little surprise that movies and video games are always more fun than math or reading apps are perceived to be!  Many educational apps simply ‘feel like homework’.

The Learn & Earn app brings in a strong academic component to a child’s screen-time. By turning the learning process into a game, the app invites children on a self-improvement journey, letting them have fun in the process.

#2: Appreciating work, reward and value for money

Learn and Earn app fosters a bigger life-lesson for children: understanding what it takes to earn the stuff they’ve always wanted! By associating a proportionate amount of effort with the rewards kids pick, kids can appreciate the value of money. The more expensive the reward, the more days of practice as required to achieve the reward. In the end, there's nothing like a reward well-earned! 

#3: Keeping parenting consistent

Many of us, as busy parents, find it an uphill battle to always stay consistent with how we motivate children. Inconsistent motivation ultimately has the opposite of the intended effect - demotivation!

By committing parents to a clear motivational scheme, the Learn & Earn app serves as an objective and persistent steward to help meet learning goals. Timely rewarding and sticking to the budget are automatically taken care of.

#4: Escaping Performance Traps: 'The better you get at it, the more you like it'.

With many folks, it’s a case of: “I don’t like math much because I’m not very good at it. I’m not very good at it because I don’t like it."

Regular, deliberate practice allows children to naturally improve math skills. The better they get at math, the more they'll enjoy learning. 

With Learn and Earn app, a child sets out with self-selected rewards and daily goals tied to them, making it a lot easier to take those first steps towards daily learning habits.

#5: Learning Focus

Kids’ attention spans vary by development stages. Many children may start with short attention spans, especially when it involves academic or non-passive activities.

The Learn and Earn app uses constant motivation to gradually improve and sustain attention spans – rewarding children for getting closer to time-goals or for working towards them.

#6: One less reminder

Kids need reminding. Kids need constant encouragement. The Learn and Earn app rewards kids simply for being regular - that is, showing up to play every single day as a self-driven routine.

One less reminder for parents.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out to fellow parents and educators! Indiegogo has all the share tools, share and spread the good word.
  • We love bloggers and Twitterati that reach out to moms and dads, and we'd be happy to connect with bloggers and Twitterati that want to extend the app to their community, fans and followers!

FAQ:

Is the app available in countries outside of the US?

As of the time of launch, the app is going to be available in the US only. We are working on extending our reach to other countries including the UK and Canada. 

What tablets and devices are supported?

Our first release, we're supporting the Apple iPad only. We are working on an Android release though, so Android users please submit the form on our site to let us know which Android tablets you are using by leaving us a comment on this Indiegogo campaign or visiting our website and filling out the form at the bottom of that page:

http://www.learnandearn.website/index.html#footer

Parents recognize that iPads and other tablets can be a great educational medium, with hundreds of apps ready to offer kids their daily dose of reading, math or science.  In reality though, parents realize that most iPads end up becoming yet another "screen" for easy entertainment.

So as busy parents that want the very best for our kids, we wonder: What might it take to get kids to do 10 or 15 minutes of math or reading? Every single day? Without constant reminding? 

Step #1: Set up your personalized motivational scheme. 

It takes only seconds to set up your scheme. Our suggested schemes incorporate ideas that focus on 'Good Habits' - smaller practice times over more days; 'Better @ Math' - healthy practice times to improve your child's math; and 'Best Performers' - for kids that are ready for healthy practice times over an extended number of days. 
Each parent picks what they know works best for their child.


Step #2: Select skills your child needs to work on. 

Each Grade has anywhere between 100 and 150 types of questions, all designed to meet or exceed the US Standard Core curriculum, organized into 20 to 30 Skills. Each Skill is associated with easy to identify icons designed for easy recall. 
You can either work with your child to incorporate specific skills upfront as part of their reward - or let your kids pick skills to practice on any given day.   


Step #3: Screen among 100s of rewards. 

We've handpicked 100s of rewards for every age, for boys and for girls, so you don't have to spend the time doing it. Parents can screen rewards they wish to exclude from their child's selection. Or add custom ones from Amazon's store based on your child's wishes.  

Step #4. You're done! (How long did that take?)

You can sit back and wait to hear from us once your child earns each reward -  as the parent, you get to approve each purchase using your Amazon account. You can revisit the app dashboard to check on how your kids are doing. You can check our weekly reports to see how your child did in any given week. You can review your scheme anytime to adjust practice times, reward amounts, or skills to practice.



Designed for Elementary School Kids: 
Choose reward. Practice. Learn. Earn reward. Repeat.
When kids check in to the app, they first get to choose the reward they want to earn. By picking their choice of reward, kids motivate themselves to meet their learning goals. No more reminding by parents. Kids can choose to practice any time of the day. Every practice session brings them a day closer to the reward of their choice.  

Step #1: Pick a reward.
Rewards are tagged with the exact number of days it takes to earn them. Kids pick one reward of their choice to work towards.


Step #2: Pick a skill to practice.
Kids can practice one or more skills on any given day, as long as they stick to their overall practice times. 

Step #3: Practice. Learn. Rapidly improve math.
Each practice session is tuned to each child's learning curve. Drago, our dear mascot, keeps track of time, so kids have a clear sense of progress and time spent.  

Step #4: Earn your Reward. Then repeat.
Drago will let your child know as soon as they're done with their daily goal. Each day ends with a clear reminder of how close kids are to their reward. 

Are we there yet?
We are already running early-prototype tests among the first batch of parents & kids! We're working on completing development and testing, so we can get the app ready by the end of summer, and in time for start of the new school term! 






So your contributions will help us meet this timeline with ensuring that the app is ready when kids are ready to get back to school and math!
The Learn & Earn Team:
Our team combines the efforts of computer scientists, software entrepreneurs and designers - plus the curricular expertise of our content partners, the Gardner School of Arts & Sciences in Vancouver, WA, that helped develop our math questionnaire.   







Funding and Perks
Perk #1: 1 year app subscription @ $18
The first 500 subscribers ("Earliest birds") will receive 75% off regular subscription of the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math. (Regular annual subscription price is $72). 


Perk #2: 1 year app subscription @ $29


Another 500 subscribers ("Early birds") will receive ~60% off regular subscription of the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math. (Regular annual subscription price of $72). 

Perk #3: Drago's Rewards Calendar + 1 year app subscription @ $49

This magnetic calendar provides the perfect supplement for your Learn & Earn app subscription. Designed by our in-house team, this beautiful calendar is designed for the family fridge, where your kids can keep the whole family involved and updated about their upcoming Learning goals and rewards! 
The calendar comes with a gallery of magnetic icons - representing rewards, goals and other fun signs and reminders that are best served by your child's imagination!
Along with this, you will also receive a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math.




Perk #4: Drago's iPad sleeve + Drago's Rewards Calendar + 1 year app subscription @$69
This iPad sleeve, designed by our in-house team, provides protection for your iPad and features our app mascot, Drago, right on the cover! We provide this sleeve in two sizes - one for regular sized iPads and one for iPad minis, so please let us know what sizes you're looking for (default size: regular iPad). 
Along with this, you will also receive the Rewards Calendar (see Perk #3) and of course, a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math.  



Perk #5: Handcrafted premium leather iPad sleeve + Drago's Calendar + 1 year app subscription @$89

This premium iPad sleeve, has been specially designed by our in-house team and handcrafted from genuine leather. Using aniline dye and the high-grade cowhide, the sleeve retains the natural grain of the leather. 
Besides providing protection for your iPad, this is a stylish accessory that will blend equally well on the home-couch or in a business meeting. A logo subtly embossed on the flap will be our reminder of your timely contributions to this app's launch!  
Along with this sleeve, you will also receive the Rewards Calendar (see Perk #3) and of course, a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math. 

 
Perk #6: Your caricature goes into the app + Premium leather iPad sleeve + Drago's Rewards Calendar + 1 year app subscription @$199
We've put a lot of effort into the friendly illustrations and design styling that has gone into the app. So what better way to be associated with the app than to have a cartoon/ caricature made of you (along with your name) and to make it part of the app during its launch? We're calling this "Drago's Hall of Famous Funders". Only a 100 contributors will be inducted!
Along with this, you will also receive the premium leather iPad sleeve (see Perk #5), the Rewards Calendar (see Perk #3) and of course, a 1 year subscription to the Learn and Earn app for Grades 1-4 math.    Parenting Food for Thought

#1: Kids + iPads = All play + No work?

When the first iPad was introduced, kids finally had access to a computer like they never did before: a device that even pre-schoolers could use comfortably. 
Parents recognize that tablets present a great educational medium, with hundreds of apps ready to provide kids with a daily-dose of reading,
math or science. 
In reality though, parents realize that most iPads end up being something else: Yet another "screen" for easy entertainment, rather than than the educational tool they hoped it would be.

Little surprise that movies and video games are always more fun than math or reading apps are perceived to be!  Many educational apps simply ‘feel like homework’.


The Learn & Earn app brings
in a strong academic component to a child’s screen-time. By turning the learning
process into a game, the app invites children on a
self-improvement journey, letting them have fun in the process.

#2: Appreciating work, reward and value for money
Learn and Earn app fosters a bigger
life-lesson
for children: understanding
what it takes to earn the stuff they’ve always wanted! By associating a proportionate amount of effort with the rewards kids pick, kids can appreciate the value of money. The more expensive the reward, the more days of practice as required to achieve the reward. In the end, there's nothing like a reward well-earned! 

#3: Keeping parenting consistent
Many of us, as busy parents, find it an uphill battle to always stay consistent with how we motivate children. Inconsistent motivation ultimately has the opposite of the intended effect - demotivation!
By committing parents to a clear motivational scheme, the Learn & Earn app serves as an objective and persistent steward to help meet learning goals. Timely rewarding and sticking to the budget are automatically taken care of.


#4: Escaping Performance Traps: 'The better you get at it, the more you like it'.


With many folks, it’s a case of: “I don’t like math much because I’m not
very good at it. I’m not very good at it because I don’t like it."

Regular, deliberate practice allows children to naturally improve math skills. The better they get at math, the more they'll enjoy learning. With Learn and Earn app, a
child sets out with self-selected rewards and daily goals tied to them, making
it a lot easier to take those first steps towards daily learning habits.
#5: Learning Focus


Kids’ attention spans vary by development
stages. Many children may start with short attention spans, especially when it
involves academic or non-passive activities. 
The Learn and Earn app uses
constant motivation to gradually improve and sustain attention spans –
rewarding children for getting closer to time-goals or for working towards
them.
#6: One less reminder


Kids need reminding. Kids need constant
encouragement. The Learn and Earn app rewards
kids simply for being regular - that is, showing up to play every single day as
a self-driven routine.
One less reminder for parents.

Other Ways You Can Help

 
Get the word out to fellow parents and educators! Indiegogo has all the share tools, share and spread the good word.
We love bloggers and Twitterati that reach out to moms and dads, and we'd be happy to connect with bloggers and Twitterati that want to extend the app to their community, fans and followers!

FAQ:
Is the app available in countries outside of the US?
As of the time of launch, the app is going to be available in the US only. We are working on extending our reach to other countries including the UK and Canada. 

What tablets and devices are supported?
Our first release, we're supporting the Apple iPad only. We are working on an Android release though, so Android users please submit the form on our site to let us know which Android tablets you are using by leaving us a comment on this Indiegogo campaign or visiting our website and filling out the form at the bottom of that page:

http://www.learnandearn.website/index.html#footer

story:
Where does your money go?

Your money goes towards school fees and transportation to and from school for the children.

Because of their refugee status, they aren't allowed to attend public schools, and thus, they have to go to a private school.  School fees then accumulate, as well as the need to get to and from school by bus.


Who do you help?

A good head and good heart are always a formidable combination. But when you add to that a literate tongue or pen, then you have something very special.

– Nelson Mendela.

The amount of children without an education is vast, but you have the chance to help these 25 children, 25 children more that will have an education.

Baraa, Khansaa, Abudi, Hamzeh, Amani, Reem, Anwar, Abir, Nour, Youssef, Anas, Hiba, Aya, Marah, Farah, Baraa, Mohamad noor, Bouchra, Sidra, Saadah, Adnan, Ammar, Rahaf, Ammar, Sanaa, originally from Homs, Syria, are now living in the village of Barsa, Lebanon.

Yes, these names seem far away and unfamiliar now, but they have been imprinted upon us, and they will for you too. They are names that have been called out for days on end: Listen! Sing! Dance! Draw! And more than occasionally to ‘Get down from that tree!’ but always with a hidden smile.

This is not just a fundraiser for the conditions of refugee children in Lebanon, it is a chance for Syrian children to one day re-build their war-torn country.

Help us help them; these children are ours.


Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today.

– Malcom X.


Who are we?

Moni (Lebanon) organised this volunteering project for students from UWCAd, of which Mattis (Denmark-England-France), Agnes (the Netherlands), and YuYing (Australia) had the opportunity to participate.

We came with the intention to teach the children English, however, it was not us that did the teaching as much  as they taught us.  The connection we made with these children, and the smiles that were shared all around, are things we want to ensure don't die out.

We've realised now how in need they are of an education, and how fortunate we are to be attending school.  We would love for these children to be able to have the same opportunity that we, you, and many children around the world have, but we need your help to make it happen, and to let their dreams and wishes come true.


What is UWC?

We are all students from the United World College of the Adriatic (UWCAd) in Italy, one of fourteen schools around the world part of the United World Colleges (UWC) movement started by Kurt Hahn.  Students usually receive a scholarship after undertaking an application process to attend schools which represent often more than 90 nationalities in a 200 strong student body.

UWC makes education a force to unite people, nations and cultures for peace and a sustainable future.

If you would like to find out more about UWC or apply, visit www.uwc.org

***

Help us achieve this mission statement by providing education for the children, and promoting Syria's peaceful and sustainable future.
