story:
Gratitude

Greetings! Thank you for taking the time to read this.  I am feeling grateful for the support I've received in many ways in my life, and I am grateful for the support I know I will continue to receive in it's many forms.  I am especially thankful for my family, loved ones, and ancestors that allowed my life and it's continual unfolding to be possible and who continue to cheer me on.  I am grateful for the folks at Weaving Earth and all those who have shared the teachings that come through this program. They have impacted my life in immensely positive and healing ways. Life is good, and I'm grateful for that. There are so many more things I am grateful for, and I wonder as you read this, what you might be grateful for in this moment?

Intentions

My Intentions for this fundraising project:
1. Raise money to help support this next step of my life's path: specifically, my 2nd year tuition for the Weaving Earth Immersion......which is supporting my larger vision of helping create a village culture........one that is regenerative for all life.

2.  May my story I share within this fundraising project serve as a path for deeper connection in it's many forms.

3. To share a piece of my story, especially for those loved ones who may not have heard any part of this story of my life.

The Short Story

For the folks who may not want to read the more in depth story that is below, here is a short version:

My vision for my life's work is to bring the ways of the village back into our culture, to help create a culture that works for all life, the people, the animals, the land, and the future generations.  

My next step of living this vision is participating in the Fire Tender's track (2nd year) of the Weaving Earth (WE) Immersion. This is a 9 month journey into village culture, nature connection, mentoring, leadership, permaculture, and community building. We meet 3 days a week. My tuition is $8,300 and I need to raise $10,000 which would cover Indiegogo's fees and a bit of living expenses throughout the year. I've already raised $1500 and have $8500 left.

I see the Fire Tender's track as a key next step in my path in helping build healthy community through co-creating an organization that facilitates programs for youth and adults that share this educational model and these practices. The Fire Tender track of the WE Immersion will give me the skills of team leadership, facilitation, and creating the container for this model of experiential nature based education.

I know it takes many of us working together. There are many ways to invest both financially and non-financially. See "asking for support" section below for more details. Thank you for your time in reading this and for any ways that you might offer support. If you feel inspired by or interested in this vision, please feel free to contact me and tell me about it or to ask any questions.  

In Gratitude, Heather, (575) 519-9513, butrfly2hmh@yahoo.com

Below is some more of the story that I am really excited and happy to share. If you dont have time for that, skip on down to the "asking for support" section.


My Story

It feels important to tell you where and who I come from. I was born in Springfield, IL. My ancestors come from Germany, Scotland, England, and France. I am daughter to Lori Valentine and Stewart Hutchinson. I am granddaughter to Bertha and Alfred Hostick, John Hutchinson, the late Thelma Crane, and the late James Weatherford. 

My name is Heather Marie Hutchinson. I spent most of my life in the Midwest up until 5 years ago, in which I did an unusual, amazing, and scary thing, I left the life I knew.  After completing graduate school for Counseling Psychology and getting a job in that field, I realized I wasn't happy, something was missing. I can now say that something that was missing was a deep connection to myself and the world around me. I realized I wanted to learn a different way of life than I had been living, a way that allows for the health and happiness of all of life.....myself, the people, the animals, the land, and those generations that will be born long after I'm gone. My journey became a quest of self-discovery, health, and happiness. It has taken me to Southwest WI, New Mexico, and now California. It's been healing, fun, challenging, scary, and awakening. I am grateful for it all. 

Through it all, I've learned a lot about myself and what I want to be doing in life. Along with wanting to have a family, I also see my life's path as helping create a culture that works for all of life.....where myself, my children, the people, and the land is thriving, and when I leave this world, I left it better than I found it. I'm learning it takes cultivating good relationships and connection, it takes each of us cultivating good relationships to ourselves, to our communities, and to nature. It takes passing this connection on to the younger ones. 

Over the past year, I completed a 9 month journey in the Weaving Earth Immersion, which teaches, through both lecture and hands on experience, a multicultural mentoring model that helps cultivate these healthy relationships and a regenerative culture, leading to healthy people, healthy communities, and the health of the land. I am continuing onto a 2nd year of Weaving Earth, which started Sept 3rd. 

My plan after Weaving Earth is to pay it forward. I intend to work on co-creating an organization that facilitates programs for children and adults that share the practices that I have been learning on my journey and in the Weaving Earth Immersion. My intention is that I will have mentors supporting me and that I will be working with a team of other leaders in creating this organization and facilitating various local and regional programs, along with collaborating with other organizations. The 2nd year experience will allow me to deepen in the Weaving Earth core curriculum and give me the hands on experience of learning the skills and tools of facilitation, leadership, and working in a team setting. 

What is this all about?

Please check out these links and explore the website to get to know the folks at Weaving Earth and what the Immersion is all about.  Weaving Earth is an alternative education model that runs for 9 months as a semi-residential program meeting weekly for 3 days. Currently, there is up to 3 years offered, with each year having a different focus and roles within the Weaving Earth village that is created for the 9 month journey.

Music & Photo slideshow from last year's Weaving Earth Immersion: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BNnta-SfOgY 

Weaving Earth Immersion overview:  http://www.weavingearth.com/programs/we-immersion/

Fire Tender's track, the 2nd year: http://www.weavingearth.com/we-programs/year2/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

"Dont ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and go do it. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive." 

-Howard Thurman

This is a quote has been with me on my journey, and one that is also on the WE website, that describes one of the things that happens in the WE Immersion. This is one reason I am continuing to participate. I believe this quote and I experienced myself and other people becoming more alive and waking up to their full potential as my first year progressed. The Fire Tender's track (2nd year) is where we learn how to create and hold the container for this to happen. It moves us from the I to the we and draws out the leader in each of us.

This is the description from the website: "Second year participants dive into a deeper understanding of the 8 Shields cultural learning basket: the operating system of the program.  These are people who want to understand the transformational cultural mentoring model they were steeped in for their first year, and want to learn how to recreate and implement it in other environments." 

The Weaving Earth Immersion focuses on deep connection to the natural world, community building, permaculture, tending the land, mentoring, peacemaking, rites of passage, personal healing, regenerative design, and holistic leadership. We learn how to become fully alive, happy, healthy people carrying with us the tools and practices for connection. It teaches the tools and understanding to take all of life into account with each choice we make, with each action we take. We learn what it means to work together and to take care of ourselves, those around us, the land, and the generations yet to come. We learn to ask good questions. We learn to quiet our minds and be present to the moment. We learn a lot more, some things of which I cant even put into words, and the best thing about it, is that it is so much fun! 

I really couldn't ask to be doing anything else right now. I love it and it is helping me gain the skills needed not only for my life's work but in all aspects of life. 

Asking for Support

If you are interested in what I have spoken to thus far and you want to have a conversation about it or share a story, please contact me. As mentioned in my intentions, regardless of how much money I raise, I would love this fundraising project to serve as a path to deeper connection in whatever form that may take. 

I would also love to develop some new and old lasting mutually supportive relationships, I believe there are many possibilities of what this looks like, so please reach out to contact me if you feel called....... and if you aren't interested in that but still want to donate, it will be much appreciated too. Thank you! 

My vision for my life's work is to bring the ways of the village back into our culture, which includes practices of connection......to ourselves, each other, and the land. The way this looks depends on the people involved and the situation at hand. These practices are living, creative, and ever adapting to the needs of all involved. They are good for all of life and for the generations yet to come far into the future. I know it takes many of us. This is what I am investing in and if you feel called, what you will be investing in too. There are many ways to invest both financially and non-financially.

What's Needed:

The tuition for the 2nd year is $8,300. This is for 9 months of intensive teachings and experiences. It is a semi-residential program, meeting weekly for 3 full days, including meals and camping overnight. 

I am needing to raise $10,000 which is my full tuition plus extra money to help cover Indiegogo fees, and a bit with living expenses throughout the year. I will be working while in the program, but my income will not meet my living expenses.....for any of you who have ever lived in California you probably understand this :). 

The ways to support financially:

1. Donate to my Indiegogo project and receive a gift or "perk" from the right hand side of this page in return. Please leave me a message in the comment section at the top to tell me which perk you would like (if it's a donation that had multiple perks.)

*Something to keep in mind is that 3-5% of your donation will be deducted for credit card fees. See option number 2 to avoid this.

2. Pay using personal check or direct bank transfer. You can pay a one time or set up multiple payments over time. This option requires contacting me. *my contact information is listed below. You will still get a perk!

3. Working out some kind of alternative exchange to what is offered as the perks above. Do you want to donate some other way? Do you have other ideas of something you would like to receive in exchange for your financial support? This option requires contacting me. *my contact information is listed below.

Lastly, I want to put out there that any amount helps, even smaller amount donations help keeps the energy flowing and are appreciated.

Supporting in other ways:

1. Send this on to others who may be interested in supporting this vision or interested in hearing about what I am doing. 

2. Contact me with any questions, reflections, to send me a note of encouragement, or have a conversation about what I am doing. Being able to share this and also hear about other's ideas and visions in their lives keeps me inspired.

3. Do you see another way you would like to invest in this journey with me? If you have any other ideas of how we could support each other, please contact me.

4. Offer feedback, suggestions, or reflections about my Indiegogo project.  

What I can offer:

Wow! I am really excited about this part! As part of the program we learn healthy harvesting practices, nature connection practices, community building, permaculture, homesteading skills, and primitive skills and crafting. I will incorporate these into my gift for you as an expression of my gratitude for your support. I love creating from the bountiful harvest and sharing it and I've already started the harvest!  There are other offerings as well, such as a permaculture consultation, design, and install or a fun nature connection event.

Please see above to the right hand side for the wild-crafted and other options to choose from. These may vary on time of year, your location.

You can also check the "updates" section for brief writings or stories about each week of Weaving Earth while this project is running. 

My Contact Information:

Heather Hutchinson     (575) 519-9513     butrfly2hmh@yahoo.com

Special Gratitude

There are so many names running through my head right now. I want to apologize if you go unnamed in this, I could write a book of those I'm grateful for. 

Thank you to my nephews, nieces, and the children I've mentored for my work. The children in my life serve as inspiration and are some of my best teachers. 

Thank you to my partner Alex, who has been a teacher, mentor, and one of my biggest supporters. So grateful for you.

Thank you to the many elders and anchors who have been supporting me in different ways........Terry, Julie, Wendolyn, Arianna, Lisa, Jill, Bill, Marie.

Thanks to a lot of prayer I found many good mentors along the way. I am deeply in gratitude for the ways you have impacted my life, and for your commitment to mentoring, healing, and Life.......

Patricia Cane at Capacitar International: http://www.capacitar.org/staff.html. 

Bill Humphrey at Essential Skills Outdoor School and Shaman's Breath http://essentialskills.org/ & http://www.shamansbreath.com/

Hummingbird Community http://www.hummingbirdcommunity.org/

Julie McIntyre at the Foundation for Gaian Studies http://www.gaianstudies.org/Julie.html

Arianna Husband, devoted to supporting women, at Nine Passages Create Wholeness, http://www.ninepassages.com/

Sal Gencarelle & Judy Gencarelle at Helper's Mentoring Society http://manamongthehelpers.com/ & http://8shields.org/programs/leadership-initiation

Jon Young and all those at the 8 Shields Institute http://8shields.com/

Lauren Dalberth-Hage, Dave Hage, & Will Scott at the Weaving Earth Center for Relational Education, http://www.weavingearth.com/

Wrapping Up

I am happy to answer any questions or share more about this. My prayer in life is for health and happiness for myself, my loved ones, all people, the earth, and the future generations. 

Please send your love and good thoughts. Please pass this fundraising campaign along to those who may be interested. 

Thank you for reading this.

Health & Happiness to you and your families,

Heather

(575) 519-9513

butrfly2hmh@yahoo.com
story_txt:
GratitudeGreetings! Thank you for taking the time to read this.  I am feeling grateful for the support I've received in many ways in my life, and I am grateful for the support I know I will continue to receive in it's many forms.  I am especially thankful for my family, loved ones, and ancestors that allowed my life and it's continual unfolding to be possible and who continue to cheer me on.  I am grateful for the folks at Weaving Earth and all those who have shared the teachings that come through this program. They have impacted my life in immensely positive and healing ways. Life is good, and I'm grateful for that. There are so many more things I am grateful for, and I wonder as you read this, what you might be grateful for in this moment?IntentionsMy Intentions for this fundraising project:1. Raise money to help support this next step of my life's path: specifically, my 2nd year tuition for the Weaving Earth Immersion......which is supporting my larger vision of helping create a village culture........one that is regenerative for all life.2.  May my story I share within this fundraising project serve as a path for deeper connection in it's many forms.
3. To share a piece of my story, especially for those loved ones who may not have heard any part of this story of my life.
The Short StoryFor the folks who may not want to read the more in depth story that is below, here is a short version:My vision for my life's work is to bring the ways of the village back into our culture, to help create a culture that works for all life, the people, the animals, the land, and the future generations.  My next step of living this vision is participating in the Fire Tender's track (2nd year) of the Weaving Earth (WE) Immersion. This is a 9 month journey into village culture, nature connection, mentoring, leadership, permaculture, and community building. We meet 3 days a week. My tuition is $8,300 and I need to raise $10,000 which would cover Indiegogo's fees and a bit of living expenses throughout the year. I've already raised $1500 and have $8500 left.I see the Fire Tender's track as a key next step in my path in helping build healthy community through co-creating an organization that facilitates programs for youth and adults that share this educational model and these practices. The Fire Tender track of the WE Immersion will give me the skills of team leadership, facilitation, and creating the container for this model of experiential nature based education. I know it takes many of us working together. There are many ways to invest both financially and non-financially. See "asking for support" section below for more details. Thank you for your time in reading this and for any ways that you might offer support. If you feel inspired by or interested in this vision, please feel free to contact me and tell me about it or to ask any questions.  In Gratitude, Heather, (575) 519-9513, butrfly2hmh@yahoo.comBelow is some more of the story that I am really excited and happy to share. If you dont have time for that, skip on down to the "asking for support" section.My StoryIt feels important to tell you where and who I come from. I was born in Springfield, IL. My ancestors come from Germany, Scotland, England, and France. I am daughter to Lori Valentine and Stewart Hutchinson. I am granddaughter to Bertha and Alfred Hostick, John Hutchinson, the late Thelma Crane, and the late James Weatherford. My name is Heather Marie Hutchinson. I spent most of my life in the Midwest up until 5 years ago, in which I did an unusual, amazing, and scary thing, I left the life I knew.  After completing graduate school for Counseling Psychology and getting a job in that field, I realized I wasn't happy, something was missing. I can now say that something that was missing was a deep connection to myself and the world around me. I realized I wanted to learn a different way of life than I had been living, a way that allows for the health and happiness of all of life.....myself, the people, the animals, the land, and those generations that will be born long after I'm gone. My journey became a quest of self-discovery, health, and happiness. It has taken me to Southwest WI, New Mexico, and now California. It's been healing, fun, challenging, scary, and awakening. I am grateful for it all. Through it all, I've learned a lot about myself and what I want to be doing in life. Along with wanting to have a family, I also see my life's path as helping create a culture that works for all of life.....where myself, my children, the people, and the land is thriving, and when I leave this world, I left it better than I found it. I'm learning it takes cultivating good relationships and connection, it takes each of us cultivating good relationships to ourselves, to our communities, and to nature. It takes passing this connection on to the younger ones. Over the past year, I completed a 9 month journey in the Weaving Earth Immersion, which teaches, through both lecture and hands on experience, a multicultural mentoring model that helps cultivate these healthy relationships and a regenerative culture, leading to healthy people, healthy communities, and the health of the land. I am continuing onto a 2nd year of Weaving Earth, which started Sept 3rd. My plan after Weaving Earth is to pay it forward. I intend to work on co-creating an organization that facilitates programs for children and adults that share the practices that I have been learning on my journey and in the Weaving Earth Immersion. My intention is that I will have mentors supporting me and that I will be working with a team of other leaders in creating this organization and facilitating various local and regional programs, along with collaborating with other organizations. The 2nd year experience will allow me to deepen in the Weaving Earth core curriculum and give me the hands on experience of learning the skills and tools of facilitation, leadership, and working in a team setting. What is this all about?Please check out these links and explore the website to get to know the folks at Weaving Earth and what the Immersion is all about.  Weaving Earth is an alternative education model that runs for 9 months as a semi-residential program meeting weekly for 3 days. Currently, there is up to 3 years offered, with each year having a different focus and roles within the Weaving Earth village that is created for the 9 month journey.Music & Photo slideshow from last year's Weaving Earth Immersion: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BNnta-SfOgY Weaving Earth Immersion overview:  http://www.weavingearth.com/programs/we-immersion/Fire Tender's track, the 2nd year: http://www.weavingearth.com/we-programs/year2/~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~"Dont ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and go do it. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive." -Howard ThurmanThis is a quote has been with me on my journey, and one that is also on the WE website, that describes one of the things that happens in the WE Immersion. This is one reason I am continuing to participate. I believe this quote and I experienced myself and other people becoming more alive and waking up to their full potential as my first year progressed. The Fire Tender's track (2nd year) is where we learn how to create and hold the container for this to happen. It moves us from the I to the we and draws out the leader in each of us.This is the description from the website: "Second year participants dive into a deeper understanding of the 8 Shields cultural learning basket: the operating system of the program.  These are people who want to understand the transformational cultural mentoring model they were steeped in for their first year, and want to learn how to recreate and implement it in other environments." The Weaving Earth Immersion focuses on deep connection to the natural world, community building, permaculture, tending the land, mentoring, peacemaking, rites of passage, personal healing, regenerative design, and holistic leadership. We learn how to become fully alive, happy, healthy people carrying with us the tools and practices for connection. It teaches the tools and understanding to take all of life into account with each choice we make, with each action we take. We learn what it means to work together and to take care of ourselves, those around us, the land, and the generations yet to come. We learn to ask good questions. We learn to quiet our minds and be present to the moment. We learn a lot more, some things of which I cant even put into words, and the best thing about it, is that it is so much fun! I really couldn't ask to be doing anything else right now. I love it and it is helping me gain the skills needed not only for my life's work but in all aspects of life. Asking for SupportIf you are interested in what I have spoken to thus far and you want to have a conversation about it or share a story, please contact me. As mentioned in my intentions, regardless of how much money I raise, I would love this fundraising project to serve as a path to deeper connection in whatever form that may take. I would also love to develop some new and old lasting mutually supportive relationships, I believe there are many possibilities of what this looks like, so please reach out to contact me if you feel called....... and if you aren't interested in that but still want to donate, it will be much appreciated too. Thank you! My vision for my life's work is to bring the ways of the village back into our culture, which includes practices of connection......to ourselves, each other, and the land. The way this looks depends on the people involved and the situation at hand. These practices are living, creative, and ever adapting to the needs of all involved. They are good for all of life and for the generations yet to come far into the future. I know it takes many of us. This is what I am investing in and if you feel called, what you will be investing in too. There are many ways to invest both financially and non-financially.What's Needed:The tuition for the 2nd year is $8,300. This is for 9 months of intensive teachings and experiences. It is a semi-residential program, meeting weekly for 3 full days, including meals and camping overnight. I am needing to raise $10,000 which is my full tuition plus extra money to help cover Indiegogo fees, and a bit with living expenses throughout the year. I will be working while in the program, but my income will not meet my living expenses.....for any of you who have ever lived in California you probably understand this :). The ways to support financially:1. Donate to my Indiegogo project and receive a gift or "perk" from the right hand side of this page in return. Please leave me a message in the comment section at the top to tell me which perk you would like (if it's a donation that had multiple perks.)*Something to keep in mind is that 3-5% of your donation will be deducted for credit card fees. See option number 2 to avoid this. 2. Pay using personal check or direct bank transfer. You can pay a one time or set up multiple payments over time. This option requires contacting me. *my contact information is listed below. You will still get a perk!3. Working out some kind of alternative exchange to what is offered as the perks above. Do you want to donate some other way? Do you have other ideas of something you would like to receive in exchange for your financial support? This option requires contacting me. *my contact information is listed below.Lastly, I want to put out there that any amount helps, even smaller amount donations help keeps the energy flowing and are appreciated.Supporting in other ways:1. Send this on to others who may be interested in supporting this vision or interested in hearing about what I am doing. 2. Contact me with any questions, reflections, to send me a note of encouragement, or have a conversation about what I am doing. Being able to share this and also hear about other's ideas and visions in their lives keeps me inspired.3. Do you see another way you would like to invest in this journey with me? If you have any other ideas of how we could support each other, please contact me.4. Offer feedback, suggestions, or reflections about my Indiegogo project.  What I can offer:Wow! I am really excited about this part! As part of the program we learn healthy harvesting practices, nature connection practices, community building, permaculture, homesteading skills, and primitive skills and crafting. I will incorporate these into my gift for you as an expression of my gratitude for your support. I love creating from the bountiful harvest and sharing it and I've already started the harvest!  There are other offerings as well, such as a permaculture consultation, design, and install or a fun nature connection event.Please see above to the right hand side for the wild-crafted and other options to choose from. These may vary on time of year, your location.You can also check the "updates" section for brief writings or stories about each week of Weaving Earth while this project is running. My Contact Information:Heather Hutchinson     (575) 519-9513     butrfly2hmh@yahoo.comSpecial GratitudeThere are so many names running through my head right now. I want to apologize if you go unnamed in this, I could write a book of those I'm grateful for. Thank you to my nephews, nieces, and the children I've mentored for my work. The children in my life serve as inspiration and are some of my best teachers. Thank you to my partner Alex, who has been a teacher, mentor, and one of my biggest supporters. So grateful for you.Thank you to the many elders and anchors who have been supporting me in different ways........Terry, Julie, Wendolyn, Arianna, Lisa, Jill, Bill, Marie.Thanks to a lot of prayer I found many good mentors along the way. I am deeply in gratitude for the ways you have impacted my life, and for your commitment to mentoring, healing, and Life.......Patricia Cane at Capacitar International: http://www.capacitar.org/staff.html. Bill Humphrey at Essential Skills Outdoor School and Shaman's Breath http://essentialskills.org/ & http://www.shamansbreath.com/Hummingbird Community http://www.hummingbirdcommunity.org/Julie McIntyre at the Foundation for Gaian Studies http://www.gaianstudies.org/Julie.htmlArianna Husband, devoted to supporting women, at Nine Passages Create Wholeness, http://www.ninepassages.com/Sal Gencarelle & Judy Gencarelle at Helper's Mentoring Society http://manamongthehelpers.com/ & http://8shields.org/programs/leadership-initiationJon Young and all those at the 8 Shields Institute http://8shields.com/Lauren Dalberth-Hage, Dave Hage, & Will Scott at the Weaving Earth Center for Relational Education, http://www.weavingearth.com/Wrapping UpI am happy to answer any questions or share more about this. My prayer in life is for health and happiness for myself, my loved ones, all people, the earth, and the future generations. Please send your love and good thoughts. Please pass this fundraising campaign along to those who may be interested. Thank you for reading this.Health & Happiness to you and your families,Heather(575) 519-9513butrfly2hmh@yahoo.com

story:
Please help me achieve independence through education!

Because of extremely hard work on my part and the part of my clinicians, family, and friends, I am now ready and able to come off of disability!

The perfect opportunity for me to be self-sufficient has come around, and I have seized it.  I am one of only 16 people admitted to Omaha Code School (http://www.omahacodeschool.com) for its inaugural class.  To put it short, Omaha Code School will teach me to be a web developer, help me network into a good job and become financially independent and no longer need to be on disability.

My name is Jonathan Preston, and I live in Omaha, Nebraska.  Since childhood, I have suffered from acute depression and anxiety disorders that went under-diagnosed and under-treated. My illness progressed to the point where I was no longer able to work, and had to go on disability. That has now changed!

How you can help!

I am seeking to raise $7500.00.  The tuition for the entire code school program is $6,000. (Similar programs in California and New York charge up to $30,000). The other $1500.00 is to purchase required computer hardware and software.  In exchange for your help, I will be offering my undying gratitude, and will be paying taxes instead of needing to live off of them!  If I do not reach my entire funding goal, the funds I do raise will go toward paying for Code School.

Why help?

I am filled with gratitude that I have come to the place where I am at and am excited about the future.  For most people, being able to work is taken for granted.  As someone who has not been able to work for more than a decade, I can tell you that it means a lot. It is part of your identity. In order to come off of disability, and to stay well, I need a good job with a decent salary, and that is what Omaha Code School will help me do!

It will also allow me to contribute to Greater Omaha's social support system.  Having been on disability, I know where the gaps in the safety net are -- and how to fill them. Clinicians, Social Workers, and other advocates have very few ways to communicate vital information to each other in an efficient fashion.  Crucial information such as: open psychiatric beds, open spots at half and three-quarter way houses, subsidized or free physical and mental health care, and countless other points of data.  The challenges are myriad, but I want to help design a system for these providers and advocates to provide real-time, accurate information to each other in order to help more people.  This is something code school will help me implement.

Can't contribute but still want to help?

Tell everyone you know! Post to Facebook! Tweet! Call! Send snail mail! (Or maybe email) Moral support is just as important as financial support!

Thank you for your support and good will!

story:
Blue Skies Development was born from a love of traveling in the developing world, along with a growing frustration over corruption and waste of aid distribution by governments and large NGOs. Blue Skies offers tuition-free education to Cambodia’s most underprivileged children and social services to their parents and community at a cost of only $25 a month per child.

The beauty of working in Cambodia is that you can do so much for so little.  Here in the United States, 25 dollars may get you a nice meal. In Cambodia, 25 dollars can educate a child and give them real hope for the future.

In November of 2011, the village of Toul Roka in eastern Cambodia donated land to Blue Skies for its first school, and construction began the following summer. Toul Roka is a small village along a bumpy dirt road that winds past rubber tree farms and lazy water buffalo. About 500 people live here, a quarter of whom are children under 14. The school will serve the entire community by providing the only place in the village with access to running water, electricity and the Internet. The campus currently features a library and tutoring space. Once complete, the school will include 4 classrooms, living quarters for 4-5 teachers. These facilities will ensure that the 125 village children have access to quality grade 1-6 education and a brighter future.  

Blue Skies is seeking to raise $25,000 for Phase II of the project. We are a registered 501c3 educational charity and all donations are tax-deductible in the United States. All our donors, no matter the size of donation, have a chance to leave their marks on all parts of the school. You can choose to add your name and an inspiring personal message from you inside a child’s textbook for a $25 donation, sponsor a year of a child’s education and get your name as their sponsor on their year-end diploma for a $300 donation, or even have the entire school named after you for a $100,000 gift. No matter your donation, the community will know that your personal generosity made their dreams possible.

We believe that responsible (and ultimately successful) development involves partnering with the community to promote their ownership and eventual leadership of the school. Building on land secured in direct partnership with the village fosters this vision. We are not simply “in” the community, but part of it. The site also shares land with the village pagoda, linking the historical means of schooling with our efforts to develop modern education practices.

The classrooms will provide formal instruction space for Khmer and English language studies, math, and rotating skills training. Dormitories will ensure our two onsite Cambodian teachers have affordable housing and access to their students. A third boarding room will be reserved for rotating volunteers–English language teachers, skilled professionals, or international students looking to make an impact–maybe YOU!

Even if you cannot donate at this time, you can help us in other ways. Want to participate in a book drive for our school? Contact us to learn how you can help. Thinking about doing service work overseas? Get in touch with us about volunteer work with Blue Skies in Toul Roka.

The people of Toul Roka want to create a future for themselves and their children, they want to better their lives, and we think that we can help them to do that.

story:
Please Help Me Help My Children.......

My name is William Drake, I am a 35 year old father of 5 wonderful children. 1 is my fiancés, 1 is both Mine and my fiancés Mia's together, and 3 of mine from my previous marriage Korbin 15, Preston 11, and Ava-Marie 7 ( who is Autistic and Epileptic )  Together we make a family. We have been fighting as hard as we can for the past 3 years. We have spent upwards of $25,000 all included fighting for the safety of our children, against the woman below ( my EX )  and some of her family that have been supporting enabling and aiding her throughout everything that has taken place in the last 3 years. Starting with her

1st

06-24-10 ARREST

2nd

04-05-2012 ARREST

3rd

06-12-2012 ARREST

4th

8-29-2012 ARREST Sentenced on 09/28/2012

5th

01-31-2013 ARREST

 

The whole time having to pay court ordered child support, and giving half of my daughters monthly disability checks to their mother, and worrying the whole time they were with there mother, with good reason.

We had to abide by the Court Ordered 50/50 Visitation..... Meanwhile Kerri Drake was receiving State Assistance, Food Stamps , she had gang bangers and drug dealers living in house with her. The majority of which are also incarcerated somewhere as well.... Her house was under surveillance and was eventually raided. In the house that my children lived in with her, the police found assorted drugs, scales, and everything needed to sell them, loaded unlocked stolen guns.... However, Kerri was only arrested for marijuana found in the ashtray next to her bed. Jeff Padilla her friend that she moved into Korbins bedroom was the one that was arrested for all of the drugs and loaded guns. Supposedly she knew nothing of any of the drugs or guns... "Really?"

However, She did drugs on several occasions with my 14 year old son, she and her friends provided him with drugs to give and sell to his friends.... She had a family of 3 of her friends living and sleeping in the bedroom with my 6 year old daughter. A grown man, his girl friend and her son.  While my 10 year old slept downstairs on a couch... These are just a few examples of the things that we are trying to keep my children away from..... this is their youth, their innocents she is taking from them. In 2010 She also falsely filled my daughters epilepsy prescription taking them herself and distributing them to her friends...  During her first arrests in April and June of 2012 both between 2 and 4am she was suppose to be CARING FOR AND BEING A MOTHER TO our children. Since both times it was her court ordered 50/50 time with the children..... She's been arrested for Battery/Domestic violence on me, along with multiple drug charges as you can see above in her mugshots/arrest records. Did I mention this is the home that belongs to her mother and step father? That her mother bonded her out of jail. Or, that this fact and information was not passed on to make us aware. It was found out by us on June 24th 2012 because of googling her name and getting a surprise of not just seeing her mugshot from 2010 but 2 more from April and June of 2013. Never given a good reason why we were told.... but, I am sure you can assume why?

Then there was YOUTUBE videos posted by her boyfriend David Linck of there friends partying at her home. David driving the kids to school yes youtube videos of this, Did I mention he has no license and hasn't for years, but he was still driving them. But the most unbelievable video was the one found of Kadeem Vonn another friend of  Kerri's sitting on Kerri's couch, How do I know this was Kerri's couch you ask? Well the wall behind him has pictures of my children all over it and it wasn't my wall.... her boyfriend also posted this video. So this Kadeem "MO" Vonn was sitting there making gang signs, gestures and talking smack then about  46 seconds into the video he gets up and then sits back down a few seconds later with a a gun tucked in his waist band then takes it out and starts waving it around at the camera saying how bad he is and that he don't play.  Talk about a panic setting in.... so many thoughts feelings and emotions my brain was going a hundred miles a second.  This was posted by her boyfriend in October 2012. And, still from then until the end of December every other Friday we had to give the children back to their mother.  What would you do????? Worrying every day until they came back home. But it is the law and I have to abide by it.

It's has been a very long 3 years to say the least.

 After the last arrest January 2013 for violation of probation, failing her urine test with multiple drugs in her system.  Did I mention she was 12 weeks pregnant at the time of her VOP? No, not with my child just encase you went hmmm?  We have not been together since 2010.  All of this is public record.  She did recently give birth to a little boy. I wish all the best for him. I also pray that there is someone that will fight to keep him safe.

January 2013 We were finally granted TEMPORARY custody of the children, as she was in court ordered " in-patient" rehab facility as part of her VOP agreement. We are still in court hearings to get PERMANENT full custody. And, she is insisting that she get 50/50 joint custody again. Even after everything that has happened. This Is why I am on here asking, begging and pleading for help.. Anything you can give will help! As I said in the beginning I am the sole financial provider, My fiancé Mia, The children gave her the name MaMa Mia by their decision, Mia helps in taking care of the children, our home and everything that entails.... Which is a never ending task in itself and she is also going to college full time to become a nurse, and we are now down to a single car, because the engine blew in my car.  Along with that I have court fees, Guardian Ad Litem fees, Attorney fees that I am continuing to pay indefinitely as long as this is going on.... And that has nothing to do with the every day cost of living Rent, Electric, Phone, Car payment, Insurance, Gas, Food. And all the other needs that come from having a family. Again I am the sole monetary provider for all of this to happen.  With that being said a 2nd car payment at this point is totally out of the question.

We do not get food stamps or any other assistance.  Although we have gone to food banks when needed. Many thanks to the Hope food bank in Oviedo.

I believe sometimes you have to put pride aside and ask for help! Sometimes you just need to stand up look into the heavens and shout.... LORD I NEED YOUR HELP! And setting up this site is the answer I got.... So by doing this I am praying that you are able to help me, keep my family safe. Even if it is $1 it is something and truly every penny will help. Please if You can see it in your hearts, to help me keep 3 children who are the victims in all this, safe and to just let them be kids.

truly anything will help...

I am a realest and I know times are tough and money is tight for everyone, Send Prayers and kind thoughts.... or maybe if you can't help right now but could Please!!!!!!  Pass this Page on to your family or friends and ask them to open the link and to pass it on to theirs... PLEASE!!! HELP ME HELP MY CHILDREN.... Thank You and God Bless, William Drake and MaMa Mia 

TO THE WORLD YOU MAY BE ONE PERSON, BUT, TO ONE PERSON YOU MAY BE THE WORLD

P.S.

All of the court cases are part of public records if you want to look them up feel free to do so... Seminoleclerks.org or If you have any other questions can simply I will share everything.

Thank you for your time and assistance

Bless you,

William, Mia, Korbin, Lexi, Preston, Ava-Marie and Miabella
story_txt:
Please Help Me Help My Children.......

My name is William Drake, I am a 35 year old father of 5 wonderful children. 1 is my fiancés, 1 is both Mine and my fiancés Mia's together, and 3 of mine from my previous marriage Korbin 15, Preston 11, and Ava-Marie 7 ( who is Autistic and Epileptic )  Together we make a family. We have been fighting as hard as we can for the past 3 years. We have spent upwards of $25,000 all included fighting for the safety of our children, against the woman below ( my EX )  and some of her family that have been supporting enabling and aiding her throughout everything that has taken place in the last 3 years. Starting with her 
1st 
06-24-10 ARREST
2nd 
04-05-2012 ARREST

3rd 
06-12-2012 ARREST
4th
8-29-2012 ARREST Sentenced on 09/28/2012

5th
01-31-2013 ARREST
 
The whole time having to pay court ordered child support, and giving half of my daughters monthly disability checks to their mother, and worrying the whole time they were with there mother, with good reason.
 We had to abide by the Court Ordered 50/50 Visitation..... Meanwhile Kerri Drake was receiving State Assistance, Food Stamps , she had gang bangers and drug dealers living in house with her. The majority of which are also incarcerated somewhere as well.... Her house was under surveillance and was eventually raided. In the house that my children lived in with her, the police found assorted drugs, scales, and everything needed to sell them, loaded unlocked stolen guns.... However, Kerri was only arrested for marijuana found in the ashtray next to her bed. Jeff Padilla her friend that she moved into Korbins bedroom was the one that was arrested for all of the drugs and loaded guns. Supposedly she knew nothing of any of the drugs or guns... "Really?" 
However, She did drugs on several occasions with my 14 year old son, she and her friends provided him with drugs to give and sell to his friends.... She had a family of 3 of her friends living and sleeping in the bedroom with my 6 year old daughter. A grown man, his girl friend and her son.  While my 10 year old slept downstairs on a couch... These are just a few examples of the things that we are trying to keep my children away from..... this is their youth, their innocents she is taking from them. In 2010 She also falsely filled my daughters epilepsy prescription taking them herself and distributing them to her friends...  During her first arrests in April and June of 2012 both between 2 and 4am she was suppose to be CARING FOR AND BEING A MOTHER TO our children. Since both times it was her court ordered 50/50 time with the children..... She's been arrested for Battery/Domestic violence on me, along with multiple drug charges as you can see above in her mugshots/arrest records. Did I mention this is the home that belongs to her mother and step father? That her mother bonded her out of jail. Or, that this fact and information was not passed on to make us aware. It was found out by us on June 24th 2012 because of googling her name and getting a surprise of not just seeing her mugshot from 2010 but 2 more from April and June of 2013. Never given a good reason why we were told.... but, I am sure you can assume why? 
Then there was YOUTUBE videos posted by her boyfriend David Linck of there friends partying at her home. David driving the kids to school yes youtube videos of this, Did I mention he has no license and hasn't for years, but he was still driving them. But the most unbelievable video was the one found of Kadeem Vonn another friend of  Kerri's sitting on Kerri's couch, How do I know this was Kerri's couch you ask? Well the wall behind him has pictures of my children all over it and it wasn't my wall.... her boyfriend also posted this video. So this Kadeem "MO" Vonn was sitting there making gang signs, gestures and talking smack then about  46 seconds into the video he gets up and then sits back down a few seconds later with a a gun tucked in his waist band then takes it out and starts waving it around at the camera saying how bad he is and that he don't play.  Talk about a panic setting in.... so many thoughts feelings and emotions my brain was going a hundred miles a second.  This was posted by her boyfriend in October 2012. And, still from then until the end of December every other Friday we had to give the children back to their mother.  What would you do????? Worrying every day until they came back home. But it is the law and I have to abide by it.
It's has been a very long 3 years to say the least.
 After the last arrest January 2013 for violation of probation, failing her urine test with multiple drugs in her system.  Did I mention she was 12 weeks pregnant at the time of her VOP? No, not with my child just encase you went hmmm?  We have not been together since 2010.  All of this is public record.  She did recently give birth to a little boy. I wish all the best for him. I also pray that there is someone that will fight to keep him safe.
January 2013 We were finally granted TEMPORARY custody of the children, as she was in court ordered " in-patient" rehab facility as part of her VOP agreement. We are still in court hearings to get PERMANENT full custody. And, she is insisting that she get 50/50 joint custody again. Even after everything that has happened. This Is why I am on here asking, begging and pleading for help.. Anything you can give will help! As I said in the beginning I am the sole financial provider, My fiancé Mia, The children gave her the name MaMa Mia by their decision, Mia helps in taking care of the children, our home and everything that entails.... Which is a never ending task in itself and she is also going to college full time to become a nurse, and we are now down to a single car, because the engine blew in my car.  Along with that I have court fees, Guardian Ad Litem fees, Attorney fees that I am continuing to pay indefinitely as long as this is going on.... And that has nothing to do with the every day cost of living Rent, Electric, Phone, Car payment, Insurance, Gas, Food. And all the other needs that come from having a family. Again I am the sole monetary provider for all of this to happen.  With that being said a 2nd car payment at this point is totally out of the question.
 We do not get food stamps or any other assistance.  Although we have gone to food banks when needed. Many thanks to the Hope food bank in Oviedo.
I believe sometimes you have to put pride aside and ask for help! Sometimes you just need to stand up look into the heavens and shout.... LORD I NEED YOUR HELP! And setting up this site is the answer I got.... So by doing this I am praying that you are able to help me, keep my family safe. Even if it is $1 it is something and truly every penny will help. Please if You can see it in your hearts, to help me keep 3 children who are the victims in all this, safe and to just let them be kids.
truly anything will help...
I am a realest and I know times are tough and money is tight for everyone, Send Prayers and kind thoughts.... or maybe if you can't help right now but could Please!!!!!!  Pass this Page on to your family or friends and ask them to open the link and to pass it on to theirs... PLEASE!!! HELP ME HELP MY CHILDREN.... Thank You and God Bless, William Drake and MaMa Mia 
TO THE WORLD YOU MAY BE ONE PERSON, BUT, TO ONE PERSON YOU MAY BE THE WORLD
P.S.
All of the court cases are part of public records if you want to look them up feel free to do so... Seminoleclerks.org or If you have any other questions can simply I will share everything.
Thank you for your time and assistance
Bless you,
William, Mia, Korbin, Lexi, Preston, Ava-Marie and Miabella

story:
I am a country lawyer in Northern Michigan.  Over the last several months, local police officials have been demanding and seizing guns from citizens without any due process, warrant or court order.

I am informed by my clients, and by conversations with prosecutors and police officials, that Michigan Attorney General Bill Schuette has advised local Michigan law enforcement that they can demand any Michigan citizen with a Michigan Medical Marijuana license to turn over any firearms to the police.  If not, then the police are instructed to advise the citizen that the police officer will contact the U.S. Attorney and request a federal search warrant and execute a seizure, because under federal law, it is illegal to possess lawful marijuana and a firearm.

I have had two clients turn over all of their firearms to the local police in fear of a federal assault by a tactical team under a federal warrant.  I did get some guns back, but the police refuse to return the rest of the guns or stop the illegal practice.

Additionally, someone has advised local gun boards to deny renewals of concealed weapons permits to any person who holds a Michigan Medical Marijuana card for the same reasons.

It is happening today, in this state, and no one is taking action.  My two clients have limited financial resources.

I want to initiate litigation against the local law enforcement officials and obtain a court order stopping the seizure of guns without a warrant, due process or court order.

I need your help. Fighting the government is not easy, as it has the money, resources, and manpower to fight back hard.  Litigation to vindicate the rights of Michigan citizens under the Second Amendment could take a few years, if not longer.

We need a strong legal defense team to assist us in research, litigation, support services, and other on going expenses to engage the police and their government attorneys to stop this secret program to take our firearms.

This secret campaign to take guns from law biding citizens is a slippery slope.  It illustrates why the government should not have lists of gun owners, because it has a list of medical marijuana patients and is methodically, illegally, and unconstitutionally seizing their firearms, one poor, scared, and alone person at a time.

Please contribute to protect our Second Amendment rights against this secret campaign to disarm the citizens of the State of Michigan.

 

Disclosure:  Any monies contributed will not be earmarked for any particular client and the contibutor has no input or control on the decision as to any litigation or legal matter.  The contribution does not create an attorney-client relationship.  The attorney may use the funds as he determines in his sole and absolute discretion for the purpose of defending the Second Amendment, to include legal fees for any particular client, general costs and fees of legal and factual research, ongoing overhead or office expenses, travel, marketing, advertising related to the cause, and other costs, to include payroll for staffing and employees for the law firm.

story:
VISIT OUR NEW FUNDRAISER CONTINUED AT... 

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-haiti-s-babies-with-infant-massage/x/5471036

PLEASE support the babies and families of HAITI 

with a tax deductible contribution to INFANT MASSAGE USA:

How does TOUCH SAVE BABIES? 

* Stimulates food absorption hormones for nutrition.  

* Bonds parents & babies for confident care.

* Promotes sleep & healing for healthy bodies and minds. 

When the Educational Association CEMEA of Haiti asked us to train Infant Massage Instructors because the need was so great to support babies, JoAnn Lewis (that's me) and Jody Wright, Infant Massage USA Trainers and Vonda Jump, Instructor answered "YES!"  When they said, "We have no funds", we said, "We'll find the way!"  

Please help us get there to help them. Your TAX DEDUCTIBLE contribution to Infant Massage USA's Humanitarian Projects fund will make this happen.  

You can see us at www.infantmassageusa.org and www.iaim.net to follow our well known international, educational non-profit association helping babies worldwide.

Who we are and how you can help

The Haitian people from the Educational  Association told us, "Parents need more education, because they have problems to interpret their babies' needs, their non-verbal language, their cry, etc. We have no financial means, but we are willing to give our support to our Haitian Society in this way." 

Jody and I (JoAnn) trained two Instructors who came to America for the training whom you see in the photos above and below, Valerie Noisette and Dr. Zeenia Junkeer and they had over 50 Haitian families come to their very first classes!! These Instructors told us, "The parents and people of Haiti are still struggling to survive each day and the babies are not carried and touched enough to meet their needs to survive.  It is the after effects of the years of struggle since the earthquake disaster."  

Naturopaths WIthout Borders, also a non-profit association assisting Haiti with disaster relief, will be providing the location of one of the trainings in cooperation with the Educational Association - CEMEA of Haiti.  Funds are needed there as well.  One of the Instructors, Dr. Zeenia is a doctor with Naturopaths Without Borders (next photo)...

The Infant Massage USA Chapter of the International Association, a non-profit organization has trained hundreds of thousands of Instructors both nationally and with our International Association since 1986.  Haiti needs our help for all the babies, many orphans since the disaster and many more with parents who are losing their babies.  

We need your help to train 60 more Instructors for the country of Haiti to build their own Chapter to help in all areas of society.  These are native Haitian people who are educated and have the strong desire and commitment to help the families of their own country, Haiti, and with continuous support afterward. 

We will be giving two trainings (60 Instructors from all areas of Haiti) for the first weeks of March 2014 and so, WE NEED YOUR HELP NOW.  Please give generously as your gift is TAX DEDUCTIBLE.  This gift will live on through the people of Haiti who will continue to educate and support their own people...a wonderful gift to give in the name of a loved one at this giving season.  THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!

The Impact:

Recently, Infant Massage International Humanitarian projects trained Instructors in Africa, Indonesia and other countries so that all can help babies thrive.  We have Chapters in over 30 countries to bring this tradition for all growing daily!!

Let's do the same in Haiti and more!!!


What We Need & What You Get

Total Cost: $7950.  Jody and I and Vonda are donating our time for the trainings.  We just need to get there with all the supplies for them!

55% - Student Instructor's books, materials, supplies, food (for parents and babies participating in the training) and translation costs.

31% - Trainer's transportation to two locations in Haiti bringing their supplies directly to the people and students of Haiti.

14% - Trainer's basics of food and lodging.

FOR YOUR generous Tax Deductible contribution, you will receive our trip stories and pictures.  For sponsoring a specific Haitian Student Instructor, you will receive their photo and name and more stories of the impact on the families and babies you will help.

FOR the top perk of a donation of $750. or more, we will send you all the perks above and details of the continuing influence you will make for the people of Haiti and their family moments during the training to cherish for a lifetime!!!

Any funds given over our goal will continue to support our growing demand from countries who are asking us to come all over the world and help family bonding through respectful, positive touch communication of infant massage and the amazing health benefits. 

Sidelights:  Infant Massage USA has been training our military personnel for returning vets to bond more immediately with their babies and prevent the highest rate of suicides in returnees.  In hospitals and NICU units, we have trained staff to help parents with babies born early to enable them to go home sooner by stronger weight gain and health through massage. If these high risk areas here and abroad are helped by baby massage, just think what this can do to benefit all our babies at home!! 

Other Ways YOU Can Help: 

Please pass this on, SHARE with family and friends who want to make a difference for babies everywhere, for the next generation of compassionate, caring people of the world.

This tax deductible GIFT keeps on giving: EDUCATION for LIFE!  Dedicating your gift at this holiday season for another loved one says just how much you care for the lives of others and our world.

story:
What is Cross-Links?

Cross-Links is a creative workshop focusing on the development of useful IT skills, applicable specifically within creative industries, that will be employed to build leadership and social cohesion amongst Protestant and Catholic youth in Belfast.  In order to develop transferable skills, such as computer literacy, songwriting, peer leadership and dispute resolution tools, participants will use low-cost hardware and open-source software to engage with the original interactive visual art imaging (GIMP) and music audio production (e.g. Audacity, Pure Data). We will assume that participants will have no background or training in IT, music or art. Once orientation is complete, we will tailor specific assignments to the ability levels of each participant, so that they can each produce original electronic music and accompanying interactive visual art.  Over the course of the week-long workshop, participants will work toward a final display of their original work to their peers and selected public figures, community members, media and industry personnel and community groups.


Why Northern Ireland?

Due to a combination of factors, including living in economically deprived neighborhoods where paramilitary activity is still prevalent, marginalized youth in Northern Ireland are more susceptible to becoming involved in violent conflict than their middle class counterparts.  Since 1998, the creative arts have provided a platform for promoting cross-community peacebuilding between Protestant and Catholic youth in Northern Ireland. Community groups have utilized EU PEACE funding to facilitate traditional music and arts programs for young people on a cross-community basis with the aim of improving individuals’ self-confidence, skills and talents, as well as improving community relations.  Though many of these cross-community music programs have increased trust and cooperation amongst pre-teen youth, bridging social capital amongst older youth remains a challenge, in part because traditional music and art programs are less appealing to older youth, or because such projects appeal only on a single-identity basis – e.g. Ulster Scots versus Irish Traditional Music.  Although older youth express interest in contemporary music, it is difficult to facilitate music workshops for teens from economically deprived neighborhoods because of the cost of obtaining musical instruments and technology. Such a dilemma reinforces the attitude expressed by many in these neighborhoods that although they have paid the highest cost in terms of violence during the “Troubles,” they have yet to benefit from the “peace dividends” brokered in the 15 years since the Good Friday Agreement.  This project aims to extend the capacity for peacebuilding through music to marginalized youth in Northern Ireland.


Who are we?

Dr. Laura Graham will be the principal investigator for the project and will facilitate the peer leadership training.  She has expertise in Northern Irish civil society, conflict resolution, grassroots peacebuilding, social capital and organizational leadership.   She will handle the organizational dimensions of the project, including identifying groups to work with, finding a space for the workshop, arranging travel, accommodation and catering, as well as other logistical tasks.  She will also facilitate the peer leadership and dispute resolution exercises, as well as the field trips to academic institutions.  As the principal investigator for the project, she will conduct research that will evaluate the efficacy of the workshop’s principle aims and objectives, reporting those findings in academic journals.

Dr. Richard Graham will be the workshop facilitator.  He is a music technology professor in the greater New York City metropolitan area.  He is also an accomplished electronic music producer, computer programmer, and performing electric guitar instructor.  His responsibilities in the workshop are to facilitate the music and visual art projects with participants, ensuring a basic understanding of musical structure, digital audio and visual art tools, and basic IT skills.


What do we hope to achieve?

By encouraging young people to engage with creative technology, we hope to ensure the development of multi-disciplinary skill sets that may be utilized to create original interactive art forms, music compositions, computer programs, et cetera, that allow participants to create and innovate within a neutral creative environment that nurtures collaborative engagement with adolescents from contrasting ethno-religious backgrounds.  Such an approach to peacebuilding, we argue, assists young people in identifying similarities and bridges cultural differences through creative practice.

story:
My formal name is Joanne Louis but please feel comfortable enough to call me Jay'el. I'm a daughter, a sister, a first time aunt, a friend, a recent college graduate, a book lover, a spoken word artist, and most importantly, a fellow human being.

I no longer feel ashamed to share this: I've been emotionally sick for a long time. I cried at least twice a week. I gave up my body on many occasions to different men over the years just so I can feel anything but pain. I created lists of reasons why suicide is an option I should look into. The two top reasons were: I'm not worthy and I don't matter. These reasons were my beliefs. My beliefs were affecting my relationship with my body, family, friends, colleagues and strangers. It was all in my head. I thought the universe had something against me. The universe needed to change, not me. What was I pretending to not know? It's insane to do the same things over and over again and expect different results.

On January 16th, 2014, my perspective on life has started to change. I was sitting in a room filled with strangers who all wanted the same thing, to get different results. For two evenings and two full days, I've spent my time with these strangers who soon became my friends and I had a breakthrough weekend. The most important thing I came to realization: Be different to get different results. I actually feel different. My life has endless possibilities and I believe it.

I'm a beautiful, accomplished, and loving human being and for the first time in a long time, if ever, I believe it. I have so much joy filling up inside of me and all I want to do is share. This experience was unexpected and amazing. So amazing that I signed up for the advanced course without hesitating! Had I hesitated, my circumstances would have consumed me and for once, I believe that any goal I have is possible!

Momentum Education came into my life at the perfect time. The basic workshop helped me discover my sense of purpose and direction. I can honestly say that I'm experiencing passion in my life. I'm reconnecting with my family and I didn't think that could ever happen. It was a wonderful surprise to be able to communicate with my family after years of false connection. False as in: limited and not honest. I was angry. I was hurt. I felt unworthy. Guess what? Yup, it was all in my head. It was I who was keeping them at a distance! I've also kept my friends and everyone else at a distance. That is changing! I love everyone who has blessed my life with joy, and even sorrow. They have taught me lessons that has helped me grow into the woman I am today. I trust my family and friends now. Most importantly, I trust myself.

I was raised to only ask my parents for money. So this is out of my comfort zone. I'll admit it, this is nerve wrecking. I've always been told that people asking for money are beggars. When did it become shameful to ask for help? Or better yet accept help? The advanced course is designed to help me keep my momentum going! I want to forever alter my relationship with fear. I want to discover the keys to my personal power. I want to just BE DIFFERENT.

All funds are going towards my tuition cost. I created this campaign about a month ago. I now have 4 days to reach my goal and I'm asking for help. It took me a lot of courage to create this campaign and I'm grateful that I did. I'm not thinking of my circumstances, I'm only thinking about my goal! If you have gotten to this point then I must say thank you for reading. I hope it has reached your heart and made you realize, if you haven't already that you are worthy and you do matter.

story:
What?

Make Nashville is crowdfunding a 3D printer for James Anderson's Engineering classes at Antioch High School in Antioch, Tennessee.

Antioch High School is a Metro Nashville public school of approximately 2,000 students.

James Anderson is a Career Technical Education teacher specializing in Engineering. He has been teaching in Metro Nashville schools for the past nine years.

Make Nashville is a non-profit organization chartered to nurture and grow the maker community in the Middle Tennessee area and beyond. http://makenashville.org/

Why?

Over the past semester, Mr. Anderson's engineering students have been learning the program AutoDesk Inventor 2013 and steadily improving their skill sets in creating parts, drawings, and assemblies.

With a 3D printer, Mr. Anderson's students can make their creations a tangible reality. Prototyping is a vital step in manufacturing. It's the stage where design flaws become most apparent and ideas for refinements are generated. With a printer, students will own and understand the design process from start to finish.

3D printing fosters critical thinking, creative problem solving, and self sufficiency. It instills curiosity and a desire to know how stuff works. Making things empowers students to control their own destinies and improve their world.

Which?

The printer we get will depend on what funding goal we reach. Funding raised between the tier earned and the next highest tier will go to the school for additional plastic, parts and upkeep costs. Funding raised above the highest tier ($2920 - Ultimaker 2 plus one spool of PLA plastic) will be split between the school and Make Nashville, which will use it to further its mission and continue to support projects such as this one. Costs subject to fluctuation over funding period.

$565 - Printrbot Simple Kit (2014) plus Simple XL Upgrade Kit plus one spool of PLA plastic.

http://printrbot.com/shop/printrbot-simple/
http://printrbot.com/shop/printrbot-simple-xl-upgrade-kit/
http://printrbot.com/shop/1kg-1-75mm-pla/

"The Printrbot Simple is an exercise in 3d printing minimalism. It includes only what is needed to get started in the world of 3D printing. NOW, our upgraded 2014 model comes standard with Aluminum Extruder and Aluminum print bed!"

"The XL Upgrade Kit is an incredibly big deal for this small printer. It allows your Simple to print 185mm x 100mm x165mm. Laser cut wood pieces are also included to assemble the tower, spool coaster, and small filament spool. The tower provides increased rigidity as well as portability with removable wider stance feet and a cut out handle."

Features:

  • Build volume: 7.25 x 3.9 x 6.5 inches
  • 0.1mm resolution (and beyond)
  • Ubis 1.75mm Hotend
  • Aluminum extruder
  • Aluminum print bed
  • Printrboard electronics 
  • PLA only (no heat bed) 
  • Outer dimensions: 7″ x 8″ x 9″
  • 5.25lb total weight 
  • 1/2 lb 1.75mm PLA 
  • filament Fan and end stop upgrades included 
  • Laser cut wood is standard 1/4″ (6mm) thick
  • Hardware bag for the tower

$740 - Printrbot Jr. v2 KIT plus one spool of PLA plastic.

http://printrbot.com/shop/jr-v2-kit/
http://printrbot.com/shop/1kg-1-75mm-pla/

"The Jr. is all grown up. Upgraded in every possible way."

Features:

  • Build volume: 5.9x5.9x5.9 inches - 205 cubic inches
  • Heated Aluminum Bed (super flat!)
  • Machined Aluminum Z axis block
  • All 12 bearing blocks are machined from aluminum.
  • 3/8″ ACME rod for silky smooth Z axis movement
  • Gt2 belt and Aluminum pulleys
  • Includes ATX power supply + Power Tower (ABS, PLA, etc) AND smaller laptop style power supply + spool coaster for printing PLA on the go.
  • Same great folding design, but sturdier when set up to print
  • Streamlined width, longer base, but same overall length – still fits in a back pack when folded
  • 1.75mm Direct Drive with fan to cool your PLA prints
  • Printrboard access is now underneath for convenience and a sturdier base
  • Belt tensioners built in for X and Y axis
  • Laser cut wood is standard 1/4″ (~6mm) thick

$860 - Robo 1 ABS+PLA Printer plus one spool each: ABS & PLA plastic

http://www.robo3dprinter.com/collections/3d-printers/products/robo-3d-abs-model-fully-assembled
http://www.robo3dprinter.com/products/blue-abs-1-kg-spool
http://www.robo3dprinter.com/products/black-pla-1kg-spool

  • FULLY ASSEMBLED
  • Build Volume: 10x9x8 inches -720 cubic inches
  • Heated Bed: 8.4x8.4 heated surface on 10x10 bed for printing in ABS plastic as well as PLA
  • Hot end Nozzle Diameter: 0.4 mm diameter
  • Filament: Uses 1.75mm diameter filament
  • Motors: 5 Nema 17 motors with 48 oz/in holding torque
  • Electronics: Arduino MEGA 2560 with RAMPS 1.4 shield. Uploaded with the latest Marlin Firmware.
  • Layer Resolution: 100 Microns
  • Plastic Injection Molded parts for longer lasting 3D printer

$1220 - Assembled "Printrbot PLUS" plus TWO spools of PLA plastic

https://printrbot.com/shop/assembled-printrbot-plus/
http://printrbot.com/shop/1kg-1-75mm-pla/

"The Plus v2.1 is the largest Printrbot yet–containing an 9x8x8 build volume, laser cut birch construction, built in LCD panel, an assembled Ubis hot end, 12mm Z-axis rods, all aluminum bearing blocks, 3/8″ Acme rods, GT2 belts/pulleys, and approximately 1/2 lb of 1.75mm PLA filament."

  • FULLY ASSEMBLED
  • Build volume: 9x8x8 inches.
  • Built in LCD panel for (optional) headless printing from files on a user-provided microUSB card w/o a computer
  • Custom machined aluminum build plate
  • printrboard: all-in-one assembled electronics with integrated micro SD card slot (no soldering required)
  • laser cut birch construction
  • 1.75 Direct Drive Extruder (not shown in product photo)
  • assembled Ubis hot end
  • 8×8 heated bed
  • Built in LCD panel for (optional) headless printing from files on a user-provided microUSB card w/o a computer

$2495 - LulzBot TAZ 3 3D Printer plus one spool of PLA plastic

https://www.lulzbot.com/?q=products/lulzbot-taz-3-3d-printer
https://www.lulzbot.com/?q=products/white-pla-3mm-filament-1kg-reel

"LulzBot’s top-of-the-line, highest quality printer to date. Merging technical expertise with design sensibilities, TAZ is for inventors, entrepreneurs, design engineers and prototypers — bring your ideas to life with TAZ . As the most dependable desktop 3D printer on the market, TAZ requires minimal maintenance — helping you advance productivity and reduce costs. TAZ prints fine layer heights at speeds faster than most of the competition, is perfect for small manufacturing and comes with self-lubricating bushings. It’s also the quietest printer on the market."

  • FULLY ASSEMBLED
  • Build Volume: 11.7x10.8x9.8 inches
  • Create with ABS, PLA, PVA, high-impact polystyrene, and wood filament.
  • Print Surface: Heated Borosilicate glass bed covered with PET film
  • Top Print Speed: 7.9in/sec
  • Graphic LCD controller for printing directly from an SD card!
  • quietest printer on the market
  • Overall Dimensions: 26.8in x 20.5in x 20.3in

$2920 - Ultimaker 2 plus one spool of PLA plastic

https://www.ultimaker.com/products/ultimaker-2
https://www.ultimaker.com/products/pla-white

"Every part has been redesigned to create one of the highest performing 3D printer available on the market, but also a very reliable one. It is also open source. The Ultimaker has especially been designed for non-experts and experts. With it’s 49 decibel operation threshold it’s a quiet machine and it fits in almost every environment."

  • FULLY ASSEMBLED
  • Build volume: 9 x 8.85 x 8.07 inches
  • Desktop space: 357 x 342 x 388 mm 
  • Build volume: 230 x 225 x 205 mm 
  • Speed: 30 - 300 mm/s
  • Quality: up to 20 micron (0.02mm)
  • Heated bed
